loans.name: Oktom

texts.ru:
Октом  43 года, замужем, растит троих детей - старшие сыновья студенты Ошского Государственного университета, дочь - ученица 9 класса. Октом имеет высшее образование  по специальности преподаватель и работала учителем начальных классов в местной сельской школе.  Зарекомендовав себя как профессионал в своем деле, в 2008 году она была избрана директором школы.
В 1994 году, в поисках дополнительного источника финансирования для своей семьи, Октом вместе с мужем начали бизнес в разведении и откорме скота. Стартовав с суммой 6,000 сом (KGS), Октом приложила все усилия для развития своего хозяйства. На сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство насчитывает четыре коровы и четыре теленка и приносит около 6,000  сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса , Октом обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,0000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота.    В будущем , Октом планирует активно продолжать свой бизнес в животноводстве и мечтает купить машину.
texts.en:
Oktom is 43 years old, married and is raising three children. Her oldest sons are students in the Osh State University and her daughter is a ninth grade student. Oktom has high education with the degree in teaching and has worked as an elementary school teacher in the local village. After recommending herself as a professional in her field she has been selected by the principal of the school in 2008.

In 1994, searching for an additional source of income to finance their family Oktom and her husband have started their business in breeding and feeding cattle. Starting with the amount of 6,000 KGS Oktom applied all her efforts in growing of the business. Today her household has four cows and four calves and give around 6,000 KGS a month from milk product sales. With the purpose of further growing of business Oktom has come to Bai Tushum and partners for a loan in the amount of 135,000 KGS to buy cattle. In the future Oktom plans to actively continue her business in animal husbandry and dreams of buying a car.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Tete, Província do mesmo nome, Norte de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5  filhos todos ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez o nivel superior em medicina, vive na casa propria com a sua familia e nao sustenta ninguem.

Saiu de Tete para o Distrito de Boane cumprindo com o serviço militar obrigatorio, É pencionista do Ministerio da Defesa e comeciante ha mais de 4 anos, juntando a pensaõ e seu negocio consegue um rendimento de cerca de 12.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos para reforçar o seu negocio (arroz, farinha, cervejas, refrescos, oleo e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 9.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, para o negocio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende adquirir uma viatura para ajudar no escoamento da sua mercadoria, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Celestino was born in the city of Tete, in the province of the same name in northern Mozambique. He is married and the father of five children, who all still attend school. He studied medicine and lives in his own home with his family, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
He left Tete for Boane to fulfill his compulsory military service. He's retired from the Ministry of Defense and has had his own shop for more than four years. His earnings and pension together give him an income of around 12,500 meticals a month, which he uses for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account (BIM). 
He's never had a loan from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 25,000 meticals, which he will use to buy products (rice, flour, beer, soft drinks, oil, etc.) for his business. His first loans were in the amounts of 9,000, 15,000, and 20,000 meticals, which he also invested in his business. He is committed to paying off this loan and in the future hopes to request further loans from Hluvuku to expand the products he carries.

loans.use: to buy products (rice, flour, beer, soft drinks, oil, etc.) for his business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married man, aged 23. He runs an auto spare-parts business to make a living. His business is in a busy location and his product pricing is very competitive. He is requesting for a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy brake pads and discs for resale. Moses has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. In the next 5 years, he plans to establish a wholesale business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he been able to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy brake pads and discs.

loans.name: Khudayor

texts.ru: Худаёр женат и ответственный отец шестерых детей. Семья очень большая и его жена работает в колхозе. Худаёр также занимается фермерством, он выращивает и продает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Он является владельцем данного бизнеса. Начинал бизнес с купли продажи мелкого рогатого скота. Имеет собственный трактор, который позволяет ему полностью собрать весь урожай и переработать землю. В бизнесе помогает ему жена и дети. Худаёр запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и мелкого рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Khudayor has got a big family. He is married and is a responsible father of six. Khudayor’s wife works in a collective farm. Khudayor is also involved in farming; he grows crops for sale. He is an owner of his own business, which he started by buying and selling cattle. He has his own tractor, which allows him to harvest the crop and prepare the land. Khudayor’s wife and children help him in his work. Khudayor is applying for a loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and small livestock so that he can expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and small livestock

loans.name: Enoque

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 1  filho ainda menor de idade. Fez o nivel basico e naõ continuou devido as dificuldades financeiras. Vive  na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta ninguem.

É comerciante vende produtos diversos no mercado de Boane ha mais de 7 anos, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria e atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo comerciante que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos para reforçar o seu negocio (massas, ovos, arroz, farinha, cervejas, refrescos, oleo e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 11.000.00mt, e foi para o negocio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria como forma de aumentar o seu rendimento, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Enoque was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. He is married and has one young son. He finished middle school but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
He's been selling a variety of products in the Boane market for more than seven years. He earns about 10,000 meticals a month, which he uses to cover household expenses. He is also able to save a small amount through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). 
He's never had a loan from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is a businessman and also a client of the institution.
This is his second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to buy products (eggs, rice, flour, beer, soft drinks, oil, etc.) to strengthen his business. His first loan was in the amount of 11,000 meticals, which he also invested in his business. He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand the quantity of his stock to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy products (eggs, rice, flour, beer, soft drinks, oil, etc.) to strengthen his business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is single and blessed with a ten year old child who is in school. She has been selling charcoal for the past three years to make a living. Grace has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. She expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya because she has been able to access loans to boost her business and also to improve her living standards. In the next 5 years, she plans to establish a wholesale business. Grace has requested for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to renovate her business premises.

loans.use: to renovate her business premises.

loans.name: Penda Diène

texts.fr: Madame Penda vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 52 ans et exerce la vente de couscous depuis 1989. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 21 ans et 35 ans.  Elle a choisi cette activité par passion. Mais l’autre aspect qui l’intéresse  aussi est l’aspect lucratif de son activité. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle habite. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’ustensiles qui lui permet de préparer son produit. Son objectif est de développer mais aussi d’élargir son activité de commerce en vue  d’accroitre ses revenus et d’améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Penda Diène is 52 years old and lives in Senegal. She is married and the mother of 8 children aged between 21 and 35. She has been selling couscous since 1989 and chose the work because she found she had an affinity for it. She also enjoys running a profitable business.

Penda Diène is a member of her local UIMCEC branch and is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs so that she can buy the kitchen utensils that she needs to prepare her couscous. She would like to develop and expand her business in order to increase her profits, which she will use to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils needed to prepare couscous.

loans.name: Alissone

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2  filhos todos frequenta a Escola. Fez 6ª classe e naõ continuou devido as dificuldades financeiras. Vive  na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta ninguem.

É trabalhador no orfanato CASA do GAIATO e comerciante de produtos diversos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 3 anos e conta com ajuda da sua esposa. Conta com um salario de 4.000,00mt e um rendimento no negocio de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos para reforçar o seu negocio (ovos, arroz, farinha, oleo, caldos e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 15.000.00mt, e foi para o negocio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria como forma de aumentar o seu rendimento, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alissone was born in the district of Boane, Maputo Province, southern Mozambique. He is a married father of two children, both of whom attend school. They completed sixth grade but did not continue because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family and does not support any other family members.

He works at the Casa do Gaiato orphanage. He also has a small business selling various household necessities. He has been doing this for over three years with the help of his wife. He has a salary of 4,000 MT per month, and earns about 3,000 MT per month from the business. He uses this for his household expenses, and saves some in his bank account.
He has never had loans with other banks. He found out about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku, and he requests 20,000 MT, with which he intends to buy products to strengthen his business (eggs, rice, flour, oil, soups, etc.). The first loan was 15,000 MT, and was used in the business. He undertakes to repay the loan and in future plans to increase his stock as a way of increasing his income. He plans to request more loans from Hluvuku in future.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell (eggs, rice, flour, oil and soup) in his small business

loans.name: Jaime

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 3  filhos todos frequenta a Escola. Fez 7ª classe e naõ continuou devido as dificuldades financeiras. Vive  na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua irma que vive com ele.

É comerciante de amendoas de castanha de caju, ha mais de 5 anos e conta com ajuda da sua esposa no seu negocio. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000,00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar castanha de caju para reforçar o seu negocio. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt, e foi para o negocio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir quartos de aluguer para aumentar o seu rendimento, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Jaime was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of three children, all of whom are still in school. He went to school through the seventh grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports his sister, who lives with him.
He has been selling almonds and cashews for more than five years, and his wife also helps him with the business. He earns about 4,000 meticals a month, which he uses to cover household expenses. He is also able to save some in his bank account.
This is his second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to buy cashews to stock his business. His first loan was in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which he also invested in his business.  He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to build rooms that he can rent out to increase his income.

loans.use: buy and sell cashews.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en: Samvel is engaged in agriculture. He keeps livestock, chickens and beehives. Agriculture is the family's main source of income, but it is barely enough to meet their financial needs. So Samvel would like to expand his business. With the requested loan, Samvel plans to purchase more livestock. Increase of livestock will allow Samvel to sell more meat and milk and get more income. Additional income means increased living standards for Samvel, his wife and their children.

loans.use: to pay for livestock.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a hardworking business man, aged 37. He is married and blessed with a three-year-old child who is in school. For the last two years, he has been operating a business cleaning buildings and offices. He also runs an insurance agency to increase his income. He has employed three people to assist him to manage the business. 

John has been able to retain his business because of good reputation with his customers. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy a scrubbing machine. He thanks Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer care.

loans.use: To buy a scrubbing machine

loans.name: Mamarasul

texts.ru: Мамарасул трудолюбивый мужчина, отец пятерых детей. Жена домохозяйка. Он работает на земле: выращивает картошку, лук, чеснок, пшеницу. Начинал свой бизнес с продажи пшеницы и орехов. Постепенно стал расширят ассортимент товара, купил землю и стал заниматься выращиванием сельхозкультур. Ему в хозяйстве помогают старшие дети. Он хочет получить доход для покупки минеральный удобрений и оплаты работы наемных работников. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и благодарен вам.
texts.en: Mamarasul is a hardworking man and the father of five children. His wife is a homemaker. He works the earth, growing potatoes, onions, garlic, and wheat. He began his business selling wheat and nuts. He gradually started to expand the variety of his goods, bought land and started to cultivate crops. His older children help him on the farm. He would like to to receive a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and pay salaries for employees. He looks forward to your support and thanks you.

loans.use: purchase mineral fertilizers and pay the salaries for employees

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa est une femme  âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un commerçant. Elle a 2 enfants, tous scolarisés. Le premier a 7 ans et le dernier a 5 ans.  
Yawa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des friperies, des bijoux et des chaussures  pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence sur le marché. 
Yawa a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des friperies, des chaussures et des bijoux. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Yawa voudrait agrandir l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Yawa is a 35-year-old woman who is married to a merchant. She has two children, both in school. The first-born is 7 years old, and the last is 5. Yawa has been working as a retailer since 2008. She sells second-hand clothing, jewelry, and shoes to any customers in her shop. She purchases her goods in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She works by herself. At the moment, her main difficulty is market competition. 

Yawa has requested her first loan with WAGES to buy some used clothing, shoes, and jewelry. She wants to reinvest in the business. In the next few years, she would like to expand it. 

With the profits, she says she plans on ensuring her children are educated.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing, some jewelry, and shoes to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is married and is blessed with an eight year old child who is in school. For the last seven years, she has been running a beauty salon business to support her family. She has employed two people to assist her to manage the business. Janet has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next 5 years, she plans to manage a hairdressing school. She has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a hair drying machine. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy a drier machine.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley is married and blessed with three children, who are in school. He has been operating a business as a sand supplier for the last ten years to bring up his family. He has employed two people to assist him to manage the business. In the next five years, he plans to establish a large scale supply of sand. Since Stanley joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. He is requesting for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy sand for resale.

loans.use: To buy sand for resale.

loans.name: Brijette

texts.en: Brijette is a 52 years old woman. She has a decent pension salary and she owns a kindergarten. She wants to make some necessary repairs to her house such as: painting, changing windows and doors, installing tiles, etc. However, the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for the renovations. She needs to take a loan amount of $3,000 from FATEN. When Brijette gets the loan, she will pay to make these necessary repairs to her house and be able to live in better home conditions. Brijette is shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Tufata Update Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tufata Update Group in Western Kenya! Boaz is the facilitator of the group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Boaz takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed his family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Boaz had a good maize yield, harvesting 7 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Boaz was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Boaz and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Boaz will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tufata Update group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. 

Boaz is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is widowed and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She describes herself as a hardworking business woman. 

For the last seventeen years, Naomi has been running a cereal shop business to support her family. She has employed two people to assist her to manage the business. Naomi has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. She expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care. In the next 5 years, she plans to expand her business. She has requested for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is married and blessed with two children who are in school. For the last six years, he has been operating a business of repairing vehicles to support his family. He has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to open a tailoring business for his wife. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable.

loans.use: to open a tailoring business for his wife.

loans.name: Fallou

texts.fr: Monsieur Fallou est âgé de 40ans. Il est célibataire et vit au Sénégal depuis plusieurs années. Depuis plus de 5 ans il gère une quincaillerie. Avant de pratiquer cette activité il évoluait dans la maçonnerie. Actuellement il a choisi son activité sous l’influence de son grand frère qui détenait une quincaillerie. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est la connaissance qu’il acquiert des pièces et aussi les revenus que lui génère cette activité rentable. Il est sociétaire du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou il pratique son activité depuis 2009. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits  destinés a renforcer son magasin. Il souhaite élargir son activité, développer son commerce, augmenter  ses bénéfices et améliorer ses conditions de vie sociale.
texts.en:
Fallou is 40 years old, single and has lived in Senegal for several years. He has been running a hardware store for over 5 years. Before that he was a mason, but he was persuaded to change career by his brother, who had his own hardware store. Fallou especially likes learning about the products he sells and also enjoys running a profitable business.

Fallou has been a member of his local UIMCEC branch since 2009 and is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs in order to restock on hardware items for his store. He would like to develop and expand his business in order to increase his profits, which he will use to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to restock on hardware products for resale.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is married and blessed with four children, two of whom are in school. For the last two years, he has been running an electronics business to support his family. He has employed one person to assist him in managing the business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 60,000 shillings to buy televisions, radios and DVDs for resale. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his standard of living. Benard dreams of buying a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: to buy televisions, radios and DVDs.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is engaged in agriculture. He has been in this business for more than 30 years and during this period has created his sustainable farm. Because of unfavorable climate conditions this year, Andranik hasn't got enough harvest to sell in the winter. So he plans to purchase more fruits to keep in the freezer and sell. 

With the requested loan, Andranik also plans to purchase seeds to cultivate the land. This loan will allow Andranik to get enough income to meet his family's needs. Andranik lives together with his wife and son.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and seeds.

loans.name: Leunidah

texts.en: Leunidah is a hardworking business woman. She is 48 years old, married and blessed with three children who are in school. She runs a grocery business to support her family. She has been in business for the last 16 years. Leunidah also rents houses to supplement her family's income. The major challenge she faces is competition. Leunidah is requesting a loan of 20,000 shillings to buy vegetables and fruits for resale. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en: Kholoud is a 38 year old woman, who is married with three sons. Her husband is a construction worker with low income. Kholoud wants to help her husband get new construction tools to enhance the quality of his work. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. The tools will help improve her husband's income, which will allow the couple to provide better living conditions for their family. Kholoud is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Rustam is married and has two children aged two and six. He is 30 years old and has been engaged in raising animals and selling them at a bazaar for 15 years. Rustam wants to obtain a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy a car to use as a taxi. Using the income from the taxi service, he will support his family and provide for their needs. Rustam's plans for the future are to purchase two head of cattle and 70 sheep to sell meat and milk.

loans.use: to buy a car to use for a taxi service.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, 52, is a hardworking businessman. He is widowed and blessed with two children. 

For the past three years, he has been running a tailoring business to bring up his family. He describes his business as busy, since his potential customers are the local residents. 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of fabric. 

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more business-oriented. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Paul dreams of buying a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: to add to his stock of fabric.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and blessed with three children, all of whom are in school. She describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman. 

She has been selling clothes for the last five years to support her family. Her potential customers are the local residents.  Sarah is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to add to her stock of clothes for resale. 

In the next five years, she plans to become more financially stable. She expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya, for she has been able to access a loan, which she used for paying the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to add to her stock of clothes.

loans.name: Safoura

texts.fr:
Safoura est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 2 enfants, qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 9 ans et le dernier a 7 ans.  
Safoura travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1998. Elle vend des céréales pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficulté.
Safoura a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Safoura voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer les besoins alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
Safoura is a 43-year-old woman. She is married to a driver. She has two children who go to school. The first-born is nine and the youngest is seven years old.

Safoura has been working as a vendor since 1998. She sells cereals to a variety of clients at the market. She buys her product in Lomé. She works alone. Right now, she has no difficulties.

Safoura requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Safoura would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to make sure that her family's basic food needs are met.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Guchi

texts.ru: Гучи женат и имеет троих детей. Он занимается выращивание и продажей сельскохозяйственных культур. Он является владельцем бизнеса и любит свое дело. Более 7 лет он продолжает свой бизнес и старается расширить его. Раньше он занимался купле продажей крупнорогатого скота. Гучи хотел бы получить займ в размере 4000 Сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений и мелко рогатого скота для того чтобы расширить свой бизнес и стать успешным в своем деле. Он надеется на вашу помощь и благодарит вас за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Guchi is married and has three children. He is in the business of growing and selling crops. He is the owner of this business and loves his work. For more than seven years, he has kept his business going and is trying to expand it. Earlier he bought and sold cattle. Guchi would like to receive a loan of 4,000 somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and small livestock to grow his business and become successful in this work. He looks forward to your help and thanks you for your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: purchase mineral fertilizers and small livestock

loans.name: Bahai Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bahai SHG Group in Western Kenya! Elizabeth is the facilitator of the Bahai SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Elizabeth takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Elizabeth had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Elizabeth was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elizabeth and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Elizabeth will educate her children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Bahai SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize. 

Elizabeth is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a hardworking businessman, aged 44. He is married and blessed with five children who are in school. 

For the last twelve years, he has been operating a business of selling bags to support his family. He also does farming to increase his income. He has employed one person to assist him in managing the business. 

Francis is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy more bags for resale. 

In the next five years, he wants to expand his business by opening other outlets. Since Francis joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy bags for resale.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is single and blessed with two children. For the last eleven years, she has been running a tailoring business to support her family. Hannah has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers.
 
She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to add to her stock of fabric. 

Since Hannah joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to add to her stock of fabric.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is engaged in agriculture. He keeps cattle and cultivates the land. Tigran lives together with his wife and three children. The current income he earns is not enough to sustain the family properly. 

Tigran would like to develop his agriculture business and get more income. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase pigs and corn seeds, and also renovate the barn. 

This loan will help Tigran to earn additional income, pay for his children’s education, and ensure a sustainable future for them.

loans.use: to pay for pigs, corn seeds, and barn renovation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou est une femme  de 54 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Elle est mère de 2 enfants. Elle évolue depuis plus de 15 ans dans la confection d’habits à vendre. C e son t les difficultés de la vie qui l’ont poussé  a choisir cette activité de commerce dans le but de gagner des revenus. Elle  est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2011.Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus à confectionner. Son objectif est de renforcer son activité de commerce pour mieux améliorer ses conditions de vie sociale.
texts.en:
Seynabou lives in Senegal. She is 54 years old and has 2 children. She has been manufacturing clothes for resale for over 15 years. Challenging life circumstances forced her into this line of work so that she could earn a living.

Seynabou has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since June 2011. She is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs so that she can buy fabric to make into clothes. She would like to strengthen her business so that she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make into clothes for resale.

loans.name: Shahen

texts.en:
Shahen was born in 1960. He is married and has two children — a son and a daughter. His children are both married. His daughter lives separately from her parents. Shahen's son, along with his family, lives with Shahen in the Tavush region. Shahen’s wife works at school as a librarian. His son and daughter-in-law are both jobless.

Shahen works as a machine operator, and, at the same time, he and his family are engaged in land cultivation and beekeeping. They grow fruits and vegetables, including plums, apples, pears, tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, and onions. They use some of the fruits, vegetables, and honey for the family. They sell the rest of the honey to fellow villagers.

To increase his family’s income, Shahen intends to lay out a garden, where he will grow persimmons and figs to sell. Therefore, Shahen is seeking a 1,000,000 AMD loan to re-fence his garden and to buy tree seedlings. This is Shahen's second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to re-fence his garden and to buy tree seedlings.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3  filhos, 2 dos quais  frequentam a Escola e o outro ainda é bebé. Fez a 5ª classe e não continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua mãe que vive com ela. 

É negociante ha mais de 8 anos vende produtos de primeira necessidade e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa (areia, cimento, pedra, barrotes, ferro e outros). 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e comprar uma viatura para auxiliar no transporte da sua mercadoria, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Rosa was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school, while the other is still a baby. She went to school through the fifth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports her mother, who lives with them.
She's had a business selling staple goods for more than 8 years and earns about 6,500 meticals a month. She uses her income for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account (BIM).
She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her first loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, beams, iron, etc.) to build her house.
She is committed to paying off this loan and in the future hopes to request further loans from Hluvuku to finish the work on her house and buy a car to help her transport her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, beams, iron, etc.) to build her house.

loans.name: Umoja Farmers Group

texts.en:
Evans is the facilitator of the Umoja Farmers group. Evans and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Evans and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Evans takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access the good technology offered and to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Evans had a very good maize yield, harvesting 12 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Evans was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Evans will save for the future and educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Umoja Farmers group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph Evans is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Zavala, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 1  filho ainda bebé. Fez o nivel Secundario e frequentou no curso de enfermagem. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Zavala para Maputo em missão de estudos.É enfermeira ha mais de 4 anos e tem um salario de 5.600.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa ( cimento, areia, pedra, ferro e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de 15.000.00mt, para o seu negocio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e mobliar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Albertina was born in the district of Zavala, in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. She is married and has one son, who is still a baby. She finished high school and did a nursing course. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
She left Zavala for Maputo to pursue her studies. She's been a nurse for more than 4 years and earns 5,600 meticals a month. She uses her salary to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in a bank account. She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her second loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stone, iron, etc.) to build her house. Her first loan was in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she invested in her business. She is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish and furnish her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stone, iron, etc.) to build her house.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 7  filhos 6 dos quais casados e 1 ainda frequenta a Escola. Nunca teve oportunidade de frequentar a Escola por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É agricultora dona de machamba ha mais de 20 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa ( pedra, cimento, areia, ferro e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de 10.300.00mt, para habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa, mobliar e oferecer melhor conforto a sua familia, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Julieta was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is married and has seven children, six of whom are married and one of whom is still in school. She never had the opportunity to go to school because of her parents' financial difficulties. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
She's been farming for more than 20 years and earns about 4,000 meticals a month. She uses her earnings to cover household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account (BIM). 
She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her second loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to purchase construction materials (stone, cement, sand, iron, etc.) to build her house. Her first loan was in the amount of 10,300 meticals, which she used for her home. She is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish and furnish her house to provide her family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (stone, cement, sand, iron, etc.) to build her house.

loans.name: Kambar

texts.ru: Камбар трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он женат  и имеет шестерых детей, четверо из них несовершеннолетние. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Он занимается выращивание и продажей сельскохозяйственных культур. Начинал с выращивания арбуза, пшеницы, дыни, риса и картошки. Он продолжает свой бизнес и хочет расширить его. Камбар хотел бы получить займ для покупки семян пшеницы, картошки, ГСМ, минеральных удобрений и оплаты рабочей силы.
texts.en: Kambar is a hardworking, conscientious man. He is married and has six children, four of which are minors. His wife works in an orchard farm. He grows and sells crops. He began growing watermelons, wheat, melons, rice and potatoes. He is continuing his business and wants to expand it. Kambar would like to receive a loan to purchase seeds to grow wheat and potatoes, fuel, fertilizer and pay workers' salaries.

loans.use: purchase seeds to grow wheat and potatoes, fuel, fertilizer and pay workers' salaries.

loans.name: Helena

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3  filhos 2 dos quais casados e 1 ainda frequenta a Escola. Fez a 10ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais uma sobrinha que vive com ela. 

É agente de serviço na E.P.C Barragem dos Pequenos Libombos ha mais de 10 anos e tem um salario de 2.495.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimo noutro banco(BIM) e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades.Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa ( barrotes, pedra, cimento, areia, ferro e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram  de: 10.000.00mt, e 15.000.0mt, ambos para habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa mobliar e investir nos estudos da sua filha, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Helena was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children, two of whom are married and one of whom is still in school. She went to school through the tenth grade but had to drop out because of her parents' financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports a niece who lives with them.
She's worked at the Pequenos Libombos Dam for more than 10 years and earns a salary of 2,495 meticals a month. She uses her earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in her bank account (BIM). She had a loan from another bank (BIM), which she paid off without any problems. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her third loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (beams, stone, cement, sand, iron, etc.) to build her house. Her first loans were in the amounts of 10,000 and 15,000 meticals, both of which she also used for her home. She is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish and furnish her house and pay for her daughter's studies.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (beams, stone, cement, sand, iron, etc.) to build her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sheet metal, stone, cement, sand, iron, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3  filhos  ainda sem idade Escolar. Nunca teve oportunidade de frequentar a Escola por falta de por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ningem. 

Saiu de Chibuto para Maputo quando se juntou com o pai dos seus filhos, é negociante ha mais de 20 anos vende produtos de primeira necessidade e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos.Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos ( amendoim, arroz, oleo, açucar, e outros).
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende investir mais no negocio para obter mais rendimento, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Ana was born in the district of Chibuto, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. She is unmarried and has three children, all of whom attend school. She never had the opportunity to go to school because of her parents' financial difficulties. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
She left Chibuto for Maputo when she met her children's father. She's had a business selling staple goods for more than 20 years and earns about 3,000 meticals a month. She uses her income for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account (BIM). She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy products (peanuts, rice, oil, sugar, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries. She is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to invest in her business and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy products (peanuts, rice, oil, sugar, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries.

loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Bega kwa Bega Group in Western Kenya! Abdalla is the facilitator of the Bega kwa Bega group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

 Abdalla is a father of two children. He joined One Acre Fund due to the firm's best prices offered and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure quality harvest. In the recent 2011 season, Abdalla had a good maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Abdalla was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Abdalla and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Abdalla will save for future use and ensure food security for his family. 

In 2012, the members of Bega kwa Bega group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize. 

Abdalla is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Zelia

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2  filhos  que ainda frequentam a Escolinha. Fez a 8ª classe e parou por falta de por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais uma sobrinha que vive com ela. 

É negociante ha mais de 2 anos dedica-se a compra e venda de ovos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos.Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 14.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar caixas de ovos na R.S.A. para aumentar a quantidade de sua mercadoria.O primeiro emprestimo foi de 7.000.00mt, para o comercio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar o seu negocio construindo um estabelecimento para a venda de produtos de primeira necessidade, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku
texts.en:
Zelia was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is married and has two children, both of whom are still in school. She went to school through the eighth grade but had to drop out because of her parents' financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports a niece who lives with them.
She's been a businesswoman for more than two years, buying and selling eggs, and earns about 3,000 meticals a month. She uses her salary for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account (BIM). She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 14,000 meticals, which she will use to buy crates of eggs to increase the quantity of her stock. Her first loan, for 7,000 meticals, was also invested in her business. She is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand her business by building a shop to sell staple goods.

loans.use: to buy eggs for her business.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Mademoiselle  Fatou est une femme de 43 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle est gérante d’un salon de coiffure.  Elle fait  en meme temps  du petit commerce.  En plus elle évolue dans le milieu du théâtre.  Elle  a choisi son  métier par passion.  Ce qui lui plait le plus c’est l’encadrement qu’elle assure à ses élèves. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la zone ou est localisé son salon, de coiffure depuis mars 2006. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 prévu pour l’achat de mèches, greffages, et autres produits divers qu’elle  va revendre à sa clientèle. Les bénéfices que lui procure son activité sont utilisés pour soutenir sa famille mais aussi pour moderniser son salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
Fatou is 43 years old and lives in Senegal. She runs a hair salon and is also a small retailer. She is also active in the theatre. Fatou chose her line of work because she felt an affinity for it. What she loves the most is giving her students a good foundation of knowledge.

She has been a member of her local UIMCEC branch since March 2006 and is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs so that she can buy hair extensions, hair weaves and other products to sell to her customers. She uses the profits from her business to support her family and modernise her hair salon.

loans.use: to buy hair products for resale.

loans.name: Sidia

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3  filhos  que ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 11ª classe e parou por falta de por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais uma sobrinha que vive com ela. 

É negociante ha mais de 6 anos dedica-se a venda de roupa usada e bebidas e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos.Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 13.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa e caixas de bebidas para aumentar a quantidade de sua mercadoria.Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 6.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt, e 13.000.00mt, ambos para o negocio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende desenvolver o seu negocio e concluir a obra da sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is single and has three children who still attend school. She completed 11th grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports a niece who lives with her.
She has been a businesswoman for over six years. She sells used clothing and beverages and earns an income of about 3.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this insitution. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku. It is for 13.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase loads of used clothing and boxes of beverages in order to increase the volume of her merchandise. The other loans were for 6.000mt, 12.000mt and 13.000mt, all for her business.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she intends to expand her business and finish building her house. For that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for selling.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 1  filho  que ainda frequenta a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais duas irmãs enviando lhes dinheiro para ajudar nas dispesas. 

É negociante ha mais de 5 anos dedica-se a venda de produtos de orimeira necessidade e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos.Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos(oleo,arroz, farinha, amendoim, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade de sua mercadoria.Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 8.500.00mt, e 12.000.00mt, ambos para o negocio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende desenvolver o seu negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is single and has a son who still attends school. She completed 7th grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports two sisters by sending them money to help with their expenses.
She has been a businesswoman for over five years. She sells essential goods and earns an income of about 5.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this insitution. This is her third loan with Hluvuku. It is for 12.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods (oil, rice, flour, peanuts, etc.) in order to increase the volume of her merchandise. The other loans were for 8.500mt and 12.000mt, both for her business.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she intends to expand her business and for that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (oil, rice, flour, peanuts, etc.).

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2 filhos  dos quais um trabalha e o outro frequenta a Escola. Fez a 5ª classe e parou por falta de por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É negociante ha mais de 2 anos dedica-se a venda de produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.700.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimo noutro banco(SENCOR) e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades.Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos(amendoim, arroz, farinha, sumos, refrescos, e outros.), para aumentar a quantidade de sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende fazer crescer o seu negocio e ampliar a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is married and has two children. One of them is in the workforce and the other one still attends school. She completed 5th grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman for over two years. She sells various goods and earns an income of about 4.700mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had a loan in another bank (SENCOR) and she was able to repay it without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this insitution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods (peanuts, rice, flour, juice, refreshments, etc.) in order to increase the volume of her merchandise.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she intends to expand her business and make home improvements. For that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (peanuts, rice, flour, juice, refreshments, etc.).

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is engaged in agriculture. She lives together with her pensioner parents, who help her with the agriculture business. Unfortunately, the current income and her parents' stipend are not enough to make ends meet. 

Narine would like to increase the number of cattle and develop more farming. With the requested loan, Narine plans to purchase livestock. This will allow Narine to increase her income and insure prosperous living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for livestock.

loans.name: Adlah

texts.en:
Adlah is a 30-year-old young woman who is married with three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Adlah wants to complete two rooms in her house by installing tiles, installing windows and doors, painting, etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs a loan of $3,000 from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). When Adlah gets the loan, she will pay the expenses to finish the two rooms and live with her family in better home conditions. 

Adlah is a conservative woman, so her husband Khaled is photographed instead.

loans.use: To complete two rooms in her house.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, solteira e não tem filhos.Nunca teve oportunidade de estudar por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Trabalha na Estação Agrária de Umbeluzi ha mais de 19 anos e tem um salario de 3.650.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos,conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa(areia, barrotes, ferro, cimento, e outros.).O primeiro emprestimo foi de 12.000.00mt, para habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da a sua casa e construir dependências para aluguer, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Chibuto, province of Gaza, southern Mozambique. She is single and doesn't have children. She never had the opportunity to study because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has worked at Umbeluzi Rural Station for over 19 years and earns a salary of 3.650mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has hever had loans in other banks. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 12.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to continue building her house (sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.). The first loan was for 12.000mt, for personal housing.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she intends to finish the construction and also build rooms for renting. For that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to continue building her house (sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5 filhos 4 dos quais frequentam a Escola.Fez a 12ª clase e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Gaza para Maputo a procura de emprego,é recepcionista no Partido Frelimo ha mais de 9 anos e tem um salario de 5.390.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos,conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa(blocos, areia, barrotes, ferro, cimento, e outros.).Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 6.000.00mt, 7.500.00mt, 11.000.00mt, e 13.500.00mt, para habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da a sua casa e mobiliar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the district of Chibuto, province of Gaza, southern Mozambique. He is married and has five children, four of which attend school. He completed 12th grade and stopped because his parents lacked financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns and does not support anyone else.
He left Gaza for Maputo in search of a job. He has been a receptionist for the Frelimo Party for over nine years and earns a salary of 5.390mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never had loans in other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku. It is for 12.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to continue building his house (cinder blocks, sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.). The other loans were for 6.000mt, 7.500mt, 11.000mt and 13.500mt, for personal housing.
He pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future he intends to finish building and furnishing his house. For that purpose he plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to continue building his house (cinder blocks, sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Furaha B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Furaha B Group in Western Kenya! Francis is the facilitator of the Furaha B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Francis joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed the family and have additional maize profits to educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Francis had a good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Francis was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Francis and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Francis will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in business.

 In 2012, the members of Furaha B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. 

Francis is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Cheta A Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Cheta A SHG Group in Western Kenya! Roselidah is the facilitator of the Cheta A SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Roselidah takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to increase production and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Roselidah had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Roselidah was only able to harvest two bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Roselidah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Roselidah will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Cheta A SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Roselidah with her group members and the field officer (who is standing on the far left).

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ndeye Sine

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Sine est âgée  de 37 ans et vit au Sénégal.  Elle est mère de 4 enfant dont l’âge  varie entre un ans six mois et 15 ans. Elle évolue dans le commerce  depuis plus de 10 ans et pratique la vente de bijoux et  de tissus.  Elle a choisi cette activité à cause de sa rentabilité.  Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est l’autonomie financière que lui assure cette dernière. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2006. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et de bijoux a revendre. Ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter ses bénéfices et d’améliorer la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Ndeye Sine is 37 years old and lives in Senegal. She is the mother of four children ranging from 1.5 to 15 years of age. She has been working as a vendor for over 10 years, selling jewelry and fabrics. She has chosen this type of business because of its profitability. She is particularly interested in the financial autonomy afforded to her by this business. She has been a member of a branch of U-IMCEC since April 2006. She is seeking a loan of 400,000 West African francs to buy fabrics and jewelry for resale. This financing will allow her to increase her revenue and to improve the socioeconomic situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and fabrics for resale

loans.name: Tatevik

texts.en:
Tatevik is a young beekeeper from Kapan, Armenia. She has been engaged in beekeeping for three years. Tatevik needs some financial investments to expand her business. With the requested loan she plans to purchase beehives. 

With the help of this loan, Tatevik will be able to sell more honey and get additional income. This will allow Tatevik to renovate and expand her house, which means improved living conditions for her children in the future. Tatevik lives with her husband and mother-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for beehives

loans.name: Alfeu

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Massinga, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 7 filhos 3 dos quais frequentam a Escola e os outros trabalham.Fez a 4ª clase e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 1 neto que vive com ele. 

Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida.É motorista na Macademia dos Libombos ha mais de 4 anos e tem um salario de 8.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos,conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa(areia, barrotes, ferro, cimento, e outros.).O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt, para habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da a sua casa e comprar um trator para investir na actividade agricola, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the district of Massinga, province of Inhambane, southern Mozambique. He is married and has seven children. Three of them still attend school and the other ones are in the workforce. He completed 4th grade and stopped because his parents lacked financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports one grandson who lives with him.
He left Inhambane for Maputo in search of better living conditions. He has been a driver for Libombos Academy for over four years and earns a salary of 8.500mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never had loans in other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to continue building his house (sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.). The first loan was for 10.000mt, for personal housing.
He pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future he intends to finish building his house and to buy a tractor in order to invest in farming. For that purpose he plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to continue building his house (sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Talekh

texts.en: Talekh has owned a business selling animals for eight years. He is married and has three adult children. Currently he provides for his family using the income gained from selling animals he has raised and products he has produced in his yard at a bazaar. Due to a lack of funds, he cannot develop his agricultural and farming efforts at the same time. Therefore, the purpose of the loan of 1,000 AZN is to buy seeds for planting in order to be a successful farmer. His future plans include the sale of milk and cream. Talekh hopes that you will support him and thanks you in advance for this.

loans.use: To buy wheat seeds.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, viuvo e pai de 7 filhos 3 dos quais frequentam a Escola.Fez a 4ª clase e parou por quando foi incorporado no serviço Militar em 1978. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 2 netos que vivem com ele. 

É guarda na Bananalândia recepcionista no Partido Frelimo ha mais de 9 anos e tem um salario de 6.200.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos,conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 11.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa(chapas, areia, barrotes, ferro, cimento, e outros.).Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.000.00mt, e 15.000.00mt, para habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da a sua casa e mobiliar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. He is a widower and has seven children, three of which attend school. He completed 4th grade and stopped when he joined the military in 1978. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports two grandchildren who live with him.
He has been a security guard for Bananalândia and a receptionist for the Frelimo Party for over nine years. He earns a salary of 6.200mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never had loans in other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his third loan with Hluvuku. It is for 11.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to continue building his house (metal sheets, sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.). The other loans were for 5.000mt and 15.000mt, for personal housing.
He pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future he intends to finish building and furnishing his house. For that purpose he plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to continue building his house (metal sheets, sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Acacio

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Nampula, Norte de Moçambique, casado e pai de 3 filhos 2 dos quais frequentam a Escola.Fez o ensino Tecnico Profissional e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os seus pais que vivem com ele. 

Saiu de Nampula para Maputo em missão de estudos,É Gestor da Escola EP1 de Jose Macamo e lider da autoridade Comunitaria ha mais de 3 anos e tem um salario de 8.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos,conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa(blocos, areia, barrotes, ferro, cimento, e outros.).O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 6.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, para habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da a sua casa e investir nos estudos, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the province of Nampula, northern Mozambique. He is married and has three children, two of which attend school. He attended a vocational high school and stopped because his parents lacked financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports his parents who live with him.
