El señor Iván desea comprar abonos para el cultivo de café, adecuación del lote y siembra de 1000 palos de café. Lo anterior le permitirá al señor Iván ampliar sus cultivos, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Iván, 54, is a coffee grower; his farm is located in the municipality of Santa Bárbara in southern Antioquia.  The farm where Iván has his coffee plants growing he purchased from a relative 20 years ago with money he got from bonuses and from his severance pay from a job he had at a recreational center.  Since then, he’s built his house and improved his farmland. 

Iván wants to buy manure for his coffee crops, to prepare the field and to buy 1000 coffee plants.  All of this will allow Iván to expand his crops, improve his income and thus improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, to prepare the field and to buy 1000 coffee plants.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La socia Benita; continua con su negocio de elaboracion de comidas caseras y venta de las mismas en la plaza principal del poblado, la socia ha visto que su negocio se ha incrementado gradualmente y por ello desea seguir invirtiendo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboracion de comidas caseras, la socia desea seguir apoyando en la mantencion d elos hijos en casa por ello sigue trabjando para ahorrar para los estudios futuros de sus hijos. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de comidas caseras.
texts.en: Benita continues making home-cooked meals to sell in her town’s main square.  She has seen her business grow gradually and wants to continue investing in it so needs to buy ingredients to make the home-cooked meals.  She wants to continue supporting her children at home and this is why she continues to work to save up for their future schooling.  She requests the loan to buy ingredients to prepare home-cooked meals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare home-cooked meals.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marleni; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas, chompas y polos y también la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de comida en forma ambulatoria, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa y negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, chompas y blusas y también para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, azúcar, verduras, pollo y carne al por mayor. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marleni, 28, is a member of the “Los Diamantes” (Diamonds) communal bank located in Cusco belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She has a spouse and one son.  She alternates her daily chores with selling clothes; she sells pants, blouses, sweaters and polo shirts.  She’s also a street vendor of food.  Through this business she’s able to support her son.  

She wants to expand and improve the clothing sales business and the food sales business and is asking for a loan to buy pants, sweaters and blouses and also to buy products to cook like rice, sugar, vegetables, chicken and meat at wholesale.  She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy clothes and also to buy cooking ingredients at wholesale.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Kossiwa est une femme âgé(e) de 44 ans. Elle est mariée å un coiffeur et ont ensemble 04 enfants.
Kossiwa travaille comme revendeuse de céréales et SODABI (boisson locale faite à base de palmier à huile) depuis 1991. Elle vend à domicile après achat.
Kossiwa a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales (Maïs, haricot et autres)
Dans les prochaines années, Kossiwa voudrait agrandir son activité et assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kossiwa is a 44-year-old woman. She is married to a hairdresser and they have four children together.

Kossiwa has been working as a cereal and sodabi (local drink made with palm sap) vendor since 1991. She sells from her home after buying her products in Anie.

Kossiwa has requested her fourth loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals (corn, bean and other). In the coming years, Kossiwa would like to expand her business and ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Edgar Javier

texts.es:
Edgar de 20 anos, un hombre solidario que quiere salir adelante con la ayuda de Dios y la de sus padres.
Su negocio es brindar el servicio de moto taxi, escogió esta actividad ya que su padre le regalo una moto, y se animo a brindar este servicio.
Su horario es de lunes a sábados, desde las 7:30 hasta las 21:00pm.
Su dificultad es la delincuencia y la competencia.
No está casada y no tiene hijo.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de llantas nuevas y la estructura de la moto.
Su sueño es ser independiente y tener su casa para formar una familia.
texts.en:
Edgar is 20 years old, a supportive man who wants to get ahead with the help of God and his parents. His business is offering motorcycle-taxi services. He chose this activity because his father gave him a motorcycle, so he decided to offer that service.

His schedule is Monday through Saturday, from 7:30 am to 9:00 pm. His challenges are crime and competition. He is not married and has no children.

He is requesting this loan to buy new rims and the structure for his motorcycle. His dream is to be independent and have a house to raise a family.

loans.use: to buy new rims and the motorcycle structure.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es: Luz  vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe con su pequeño hijo de dos años de edad. Allí  es muy conocida  y tiene un taller de confecciones en compañía de su madre, donde produce ropa femenina e infantil, oficio que han ejercido varias generaciones de su  familia ; Su sueño es ampliar su infraestructura técnica dotándola de máquinas industriales para mejorar los tiempos productivos y aumentar la calidad de las prendas que ofrece a su mercado. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el  comprará una máquina industrial y telas por rollos, preparándose para una de las temporadas más rentables del año, como lo es la épocas de navidades y año nuevo, donde su clientela acude a Luz para que su familia sea bien vestida por excelentes  diseños que solo Luz, con su calidad en el producto y el servicio, sabe ofrecer.
texts.en:
Luz lives in the municipality of Puerto Colombia on the banks of the Caribbean Sea with her little two-year-old son. She is well-known there and has a textile workshop along with her mother where she produces women's and children's clothing. Her family has been in the trade for several generations. 

Her dream is to expand her technical infrastructure, outfitting it with industrial machinery to improve production times and increase the quality of the clothing she offers at her store.

This is the reason she turns to her CrediKiva. She will use her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy a new industrial machine and bolts of yardage. She is preparing for one of the most profitable times of year - such as the Christmas and New Year seasons are. This is when her clientele turns to Luz so their families can be well dressed with excellent designs that only Luz, with her quality product and service, can provide.

loans.use: to buy industrial machinery and bolts of yardage.

loans.name: Ober

texts.es: Ober tiene 33 años, vive en compañía de su esposa e hija en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Saño. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a ofrecer su servicio de construcción a varios propietarios que le solicitan, su especialidad es edificación de casas a base de ladrillo y cemento, por la amplia trayectoria que tiene en la construcción, ya que anteriormente trabajaba de albañil, le ha permitido tener prestigio  que garantiza la demanda de sus clientes. Él contrata la mano de obra de albañiles que lo ayudan en la construcción y el mismo es uno de los que siempre está viendo que  toda la construcción se realice en orden. Este trabajo le ha permitido capitalizar rápidamente y mejorar sus condiciones de vida por lo que seguirá  trabajando en este rubro con miras a crecer en la calidad de su servicio y en la adquisición de nuevos clientes. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “cantuta” y este es el duodécimo crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Ober, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas y materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Ober is 33 and lives with his wife and daughter in his own house, situated in the district of San Pedro de Saño. He has offered his construction services to  various property owners who hire him for seven years. His specialty is building houses with brick and cement. The wide range of his experience in construction - he used to work as a bricklayer - has given him prestige that guarantees his clients' business. 

He contracts the labor of bricklayers who help him with the construction, and he is one of those who is always making sure that all of the construction is conducted in order. This work has allowed him to quickly capitalize his income and to improve his quality of life. That is why he will continue working in this field with an aim to grow in quality of service and in the acquisition of new clients.

He is part of the solidarity group "cantuta" and this is the twelfth loan with MFP. He is grateful for the support he receives, since it allows him to progress with his business. He also promises to be punctual with his payment installations; his association is made up of responsible and supportive people. Upon receiving his support, Ober will invest the requested funds in the purchase of tools and construction materials.

loans.use: to buy tools and and construction materials like cement and bricks.

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr:
Mme Fama  habite un quartier qui se trouve aux environs du guichet : ce qui lui facilite ses déplacements vers cette dernière. Elle est mariée mais cela ne l’empêche pas de faire du commerce  
Son activité consiste en l’achat et à la revente de friperies dans le marché local . Fama a démarré son activité commerciale depuis 2004, cela fait  sept ans. En dehors de cela elle travaille comme infirmière dans l’hôpital régional de la ville.
Avec le crédit elle veut  acheter  trois balles de friperies et réfectionner le magasin.
Avec les bénéfices acquis elle va augmente son stock.
texts.en:
Ms. Fama lives in a district found near a branch office: this facilitates her trips to it. She is married, but this does not prevent her from working in commerce. Her business involves buying and selling second-hand clothing at a local market. Fama started her business in 2004. It has been seven years. Aside from this, she works as a nurse in a regional hospital in town. 

With the loan, she wants to buy three bales of used clothing and to renovate the store. With the profits acquired, she is going to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: La socia Leonarda continua con su negocio de compra y venta de productos agropecuarios para los terrenos de cultivos en la zona, la socia desea invertir el credito en la compra de productos como abono, fertilizante entre otros para mejorar los cultivos, la socia tambien tien terrenos de cultivo de papa y maíz. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos agropecuarios para implementar su negocio.
texts.en: Bank-member Leonarda continues her business of buying and selling agricultural products to make the zone's cultivated lands more productive. She wishes to invest her loan in purchasing products such as manure and fertilizer, among other items, to improve local crops. Leonarda also has her own fields planted in potatoes and corn. She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing agricultural products to sell to local farmers.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina vive en la zona del tercer anillo,  la vivienda es familiar actualmente vive con sus hijas, su esposo se encuentra en el Brasil por motivos de trabajo,  la cliente se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chinelas bordadas ella las borda a mano es un trabajo muy delicado ya que utiliza pedrería muy pequeña, también lentejuelas y adicionalmente elabora manillas y llaveros, también bordados a mano, los cuales son comercializados en la feria de barrio lindo de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, los días sábados, el crédito esta destinado a la compra de materiales para la fabricación de manillas y bordados de chinelas, compra de hilos, ya que estas fiestas de fin de año tiene mucha venta y de esta manera mejorar mas sus ingresos, la Sra. Cristina es un artesana muy habilosa ya que sus trabajos son de muy buena calidad y muy requeridos por las personas por el buen acabado que tiene.
texts.en:
Señora Cristina lives in the Third Ring area of Santa Cruz [Santa Cruz is a circular city, with each neighborhood known as a “ring” (anillo). Each ring is 1-2 km across, and the numbers increase as you move farther from the city center.] She lives with her children in the family home. Her husband is currently in Brazil for work. 

Cristina makes her living by making and selling embroidered sandals. She embroiders them by hand, which is a very delicate job because it uses very tiny stones and sequins. She also makes bracelets and key chains, which again are hand-embroidered. These items are sold in the Barrio Lindo market in Santa Cruz on Saturdays. 

The loan is for the purchase of threads and materials to create bracelets and sandal embroidery since there is an increase in sales during the holidays at the end of the year. In this way, she will be able to improve her income. Señora Cristina is a skilled artisan because her handicrafts are of very good quality and are in great demand because they are well-made.

loans.use: to purchase materials like threads and sequins for the embroidery of sandals.

loans.name: Pedro Ibar

texts.es:
Pedro empezo con un taller de cerrajeria hace 20 años atraz. Pero el desempeño de su negocio le ayudo a abrir una nueva fuente de trabajo vendiendo mariscos. Su espoza y su hijo mayor le ayuda por las mañanas en la venta de pescado  y por la tarde se dedica a su taller de cerajeria.

El negocio gracias a Dios no ha tenido ningun problema con la delincuencia aunque vive en un barrio peligroso.Con el prestamo quiere comprar marisco para tener mas ingresos en su nuevo negocio

Su nueva meta por alcanzar es hacer la loza de la casa y que su negicio de venta de marisco y el taller de cerajeria crezca con la ayuda de Dios y su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro began in business with a locksmith's shop some 20 years ago. Then carrying out this business helped him open a new source of work, selling seafood. His wife and elder son help sell fish during the morning and Pedro works in his locksmith's shop afternoons.

Thank God, the business has had no problems with delinquency, although he lives in a dangerous barrio. With this loan Pedro wants to buy shell fish to sell in order to have more income from his new business.

loans.use: to buy shell fish to sell.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
La señora Nidia se vera ampliamente beneficiada con el otorgamiento del crédito ya que con el podrá surtir su pequeño negocio de abarrotes al que le están haciendo falta diferentes tipos de mercancía que es fruta, verdura y productos de lactios.
Doña Nidia es madre soltera tiene dos hijos por los cuales se ha esforzado mucho para salir adelante; la señora Nidia inicio como comerciante hace ya once años con la finalidad de poder darle buena calidad de vida a sus hijos. Siempre ha contado con el apoyo y la ayuda de su madre con quien vive actualmente.
texts.en:
Nidia has benefited amply from past loans, enabling her to supply her small grocery business. But it presently lacks certain kinds of merchandise, including fruit, vegetables, and dairy products.

Nidia is a single mother with 2 children and she has made great efforts for their advancement. Nidia became a merchant some 11 years ago in order to offer a good quality of life to her children. She has always been able to count on the help and aid of her mother with whom she lives at present.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, and dairy products for her small grocery business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is married and has four children ranging from 12 to 26 years old. She describes herself as ambitious. Regina runs a retail store. The business is faced with the problem of increasing costs. She will be using this loan of KES 20,000 to add to her stock of goods. Regina looks forward to expanding the business in the future.

loans.use: to add stock to the retail store.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El señor Luis Alberto a sus 51 años de edad, se dedica a la reparación de bicicletas y venta de cerdos. Gracias a esta actividad, el señor Luis Alberto ha salido adelante con sus dos hijos de 18 años de edad y su esposa. Los cerdos los tiene en forma escalonada para comercializarlos cada mes en las principales carnicerías del municipio de Urrao ubicado al suroeste de Antioquia. El señor Luis Alberto desea realizar adecuaciones locativas de ampliación y adecuación al lugar donde tiene los cerdos y comprar cuido para la alimentación de ocho cerdos que tiene en proceso de crecimiento. Con lo anterior, el señor Luis Alberto podrá terminar de alimentar a sus animales y así venderlos más rápidos para generar ganancias en corto tiempo y así brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. El señor Luis Alberto sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener una mayor cantidad y diversidad de animales y brindarles a sus dos hijos la mejor educación.
texts.en:
Señor Luis Alberto, 51, makes his living by repairing bicycles and selling pigs. Thanks to these activities, Señor Luis Alberto has been able to provide for his two 18-year-old children and his wife. He has the pigs staggered so that he is able to sell some every month to the main butcher shops in the neighborhood of Urrao, located in southwestern Antioquia. 

Luis Alberto wishes to make some expansions and improvements to the area where he keeps the pigs and purchase feed for 8 pigs he is raising. By so doing, Señor Luis Alberto will be able to finish feeding his animals so that he can sell them more quickly to generate income in a shorter time, which will help him provide a better quality of life for his family. He dreams of expanding his business to have a larger quantity and variety of animals, and of providing the best education for his two children.

loans.use: to improve and expand the area where he keeps his pigs and to purchase feed for 8 pigs.

loans.name: Harriet Nkatha

texts.en: Harriet Nkatha is 26 years old. She is married and has two children, ranging in age from five to seven years old. She describes herself as honest and principled. She has sold cereals to retail customers for the last two years. Her business is faced with the problem of inadequate capital. She will be using 20,000 KES to buy black beans, beans, and maize. In the next five years, she wants to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy black beans, beans, and maize.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is 34 years old and lives in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is a single mother and has three children — two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Barbara has been working hard to manage her boutique in which she sells different types of clothing.

To help expand her business, Barbara has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bundles of clothes, and it will help Barbara to generate greater profits and to open up another kiosk. Barbara hopes that in the future she will be able to open a large shop that will attract more customers.

Barbara is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Barbara who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Mirian Virinia

texts.es:
Mirian de 54 años, una mujer que vive con su mama que es un señora de edad, para la cual trabaja vendiendo productos de uso propio, Trabaja sola y todos los días sale a recorrer casa para poder vender sus productos.

Su meta es poder ponerse un bazar en su casa para que así pueda estar descansando un poco y también generar más ingresos para poder ayudar a su madre.
texts.en:
Mirian is 54 years old. She lives with her mother who is an older woman. Miriam works selling personal care products. She works alone and every day she goes out from house-to-house in order to sell her products.

Her goal is to be able to open a boutique in her home so that she can rest a bit and also generate more income to assist her mother.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lotions and makeup.

loans.name: Reina Johanna

texts.es:
Reina de 32 años, empezó con su bazar hace 1 año atrás por que trabaja en su casa y así puede pasar tiempo con sus hijos. Trabaja todos los días de 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

El problema que presenta es la delincuencia debido al que el sector es muy peligroso.

Madres soltera con 3 hijos; los dos últimos hijos de 11 años y 4 años estudia en escuela fiscal. Con el prestamo quiere comprar ropa, laminas y bebidas para su negocio. 

Su meta alcanzar es poder agrandar mas el negocio y poder terminar de construir su casa para una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Reina, age 32, opened her variety store one year ago so that she could work from home and spend time with her children. She works every day from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm.
Crime is an issue for her because she lives in a very dangerous area.
She is a single mother with three children. The two older children, ages 11 and 4, attend public school. With this loan, Reina will purchase clothing, educational materials and drinks for her business.
Her goal is to be able to expand her business more and to be able to finish building her home in order to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more clothing, educational materials, and pop.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es: El sr. Cristóbal es artesano se dedica a la fabricación de manualidades según a la temporada ahora esta realizando adornos navideños por estas fiestas de fin de año  se  dedica a la venta y costura de corbatas y campanas por mayor, el tiene cuatro hijos que son todavía dependientes de la familia, su esposa de dedica  a labores del hogar, el Sr. Cristóbal y toda su familia se dedica a las artesanías ya que el también vende en alasitas  entrega al por mayor y según pedido sus adornos con el crédito otorgado comprara tela gamuza por mayor para la fabricación de adornos navideños, el Sr. Cristóbal es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, su deseo es poder ver algún día a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en: Mr. Cristóbal is a craftsman. He makes seasonal crafts, and is now making Christmas decorations for the end of the year. He makes and sells ties and bells wholesale. He has four children who are still dependent on him. His wife takes care of the housework. Cristobal and his whole family make crafts, and he also sells in the Alasitas market [a traditional Bolivian craft market]. He provides crafts wholesale and on order. With this loan, he will purchase suede fabric wholesale for making Christmas ornaments. Cristobal is a very kind and hard-working man. He wants to see his children become professionals one day.

loans.use: to buy suede wholesale

loans.name: Helver

texts.es: Helver, de 29 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su mamá Rosa, su papá Hilario y sus 3 hermanos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Los Libertadores de Huari. Su vida se centra en cuidar y velar por sus padres y hermanos. Por ello nunca pensó en casarse ni tener hijos. Su principal actividad económica es la ganadería, cuida ovejas, vacas y llamas a las cuales alimenta muy bien, pues cuenta que ahí está el secreto de su éxito. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de sus ovinos, hasta convertir a todos sus ejemplares en animales de reza. También trabaja como albañil en construcción de casas en la ciudad de Huancavelica, donde recibe un dinero adicional de acuerdo al contrato que realiza en cada vivienda. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “galpón al éxito” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Helver de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 ovejas reproductoras para aumentar sus ganados.
texts.en:
Helver, age 29, is a hard-working man. He lives with his mother, Rosa; his father, Hilario; and his three siblings, whom he takes care of. They live in their own home in Los Libertadores de Huari. His life centers around taking care of his parents and siblings. For this reason, he has never considered getting married or having children. His main job is in livestock. He cares for sheep, cows, and llamas. He feeds them very well, and tells us that this is the secret behind his success. He now wants to improve the quality of his sheep, in order to make them exemplary examples of their breeds. 
He also works as a bricklayer, building houses in the city of Huancavelica. He makes an additional income from this based on the contract for each home.
He belongs to the “Galpón al éxito” communal bank and this is his first loan with MFP. He is grateful for the support that he is receiving; it will allow him to progress with his business. He promises to be punctual in the payment of his quotas. His group is made up of responsible and united people. Upon receiving your support, Helver will invest this money in the purchase of two breeding sheep to increase his flock.

loans.use: to buy two sheep.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier  es un emprendedor dedicado a la comercialización de carnes de res y vísceras, que tiene su negocio en el centro de la ciudad y goza de una experiencia de 38 años, en los que aún recuerda que inició con una mesa ubicada en el espacio público y vendiendo  en pequeñas cantidades y como poco a poco ha ido creciendo y aun sueña con grandes logros para su negocio. En la actualidad su esposa lo apoya   y con los ingresos comunes, han logrado educar a sus dos hijos quienes hoy  cuentan  con 34 y 36 años respectivamente. Su meta más adelante es ampliar su negocio, ubicando un nuevo punto comercial en un lugar muy transitado,  en compañía de su esposa, quien es su mano derecha en el buen desempeño de su negocio. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará carnes y vísceras de contado y en mayor cantidad, logrando en gran parte financiar su cartera de clientes.  Su inversión será exitosa, porque le permite un nuevo capital de trabajo para hacer compras de contado y en mayor cantidad, responder a una nueva clientela  que aumenta sus compras en las épocas navideñas y de año nuevo, y aplica su credikiva a su negocio en una temporada de gran repunte comercial en la cual hay mucho dinero rotando.
texts.en:
Javier is an entrepreneur who sells beef and viscera.  His business is located downtown.  He has 38 years of experience and remembers that he started with a table in a public space, selling small quantities.  Little by little, he has been growing and has grand dreams for his business.  His wife currently helps him and their shared income.  He has been able to educate his two children who are now 34 and 36 years old.  His future goal is to expand his business, relocating to a new commercial spot with lots of traffic, with his wife who has been insturmental in the good performance of the business.  

This Kiva loan is his first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy meats and viscera with cash and in large quantities.  His investment will be successful because it will give him new working capital to make purchases in cash and in larger quantities, responding to a new clientele that increases his sales during the Christmas and New Year season.  He will be able to use his loan for his business in a season when there is an upturn in sales and lots of money circulating.

loans.use: purchase meat and viscera with cash and in large quantities.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 36 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Hellen has been working hard to manage her drug shop in which she sells medicine.

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy medicine for resale, and it will help Hellen to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for her children. Hellen hopes that in the future she will be able to become a big businesswoman.

Hellen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hellen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy medicine for resale.

loans.name: Fausto Armando

texts.es:
Fausto de 46 años, empezo su negocio de produccion y venta de arroz con la ayuda de dios hace 20 años.

Con la ayuda de su espoza todos los dias recorre los mercados y ferias libres en su vehiliculo desde las 7am hasta las 2pm.

Gracias a dios no ha tenido ningun problema con la delincuencia ya que recorre algunos sectores peligrosos. Quiere el prestamo para comprar una computadora ya que quiere mejorar su negocio con tecnología. 
Su meta alcanza es comprar un vehiculo nuevo para poder distribuir mucho mejor el arroz.
texts.en:
More than 20 years ago Fausto, 46, with God's help, started his business of growing and selling rice.
His wife assists him every day going to the markets and fairs in their vehicle, from 7 am to 2 pm.
Thanks to God he hasn’t had any problems with violence because he goes through some dangerous areas.  He wants the loan to buy a computer so he can improve his business with technology.
His goal is to buy a new vehicle to better distribute the rice.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products for her shop

loans.name: Kelvis Israel

texts.es:
Kelvis de 21 años, trabaja en un taxi que compro con la ayuda de su mama que trabaja en el exterior.

Trabaja todos los dias desde las 8:30am hasta las 7:00pm.

El único problema que posee es la delincuencia que hay en las calles.

Es padre soltero y tienes dos hijos ( 3 y 2 años) que a podido sacar adelante con la ayuda de dios y esfuerzo de su trabajo.

El sueño que desea alcanzar en comprar una casa propia para poder vivir cómodamente con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Kelvis, age 21, works as a taxi driver. He bought his taxi with his mother's help; she works in another country.
Kelvis works every day from 8:30 am to 7:00 pm.
His only problem is street crime.
He is a single father of two children (ages 2 and 3). He is able to get them ahead with God's help and thanks to his hard work.
His dream is to buy his own home in order to live comfortably with his children.

loans.use: to modify and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 41 years old and lives in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has six children; four of them are currently in school. For the past 13 years, Vincent has been working hard to manage his welding shop, which does metal work and repairs. 

To help expand his business, Vincent has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bars for making windows, doors and gates, and will help Vincent to generate greater profits and improve his family's well-being. Vincent hopes that in the future he will be able to have many customers and contracts. 

Vincent is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Vincent who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more bars for making windows, doors and gates.

loans.name: Ayidote 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOTE6 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amis et appartiennent à une même association d’artisans. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Ivadagbé Mensmin est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ivadagbé Mensmin est âgé de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Ivadagbé Mensmin est marié à une marchande du nom de Jacqueline. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de ses enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à sa charge. Ivadagbé Mensmin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille, Ivadagbé Mensmin fait depuis huit ans de la couture dans son quartier. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Ivadagbé Mensmin désire mieux équiper son atelier, par l'acquisition de fournitures de couture et accessoires de machine ; ce qui lui permettra d'accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour ce faire, Ivadagbé Mensmin sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE6, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group AYIDOTE6 is comprised of three persons whose are friends belonging to the same artisans’ association. This is the third time the group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, named Ivadagbé Mensmin, is the one in the photo with his hand raised. He is 32 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a merchant by the name of 
Jacqueline. They have two children, both in school and in their care. In addition to the two children, the couple has another child to support.

Ivadagbé Mensmin lives together with his wife and children, and the couple jointly cover the diverse family expenses. To help with these expenses, he has been a clothier in his district for eight years. 

Seeking to satisfy his customers, Ivadagbé Mensmin would like to equip his workshop better by acquiring sewing supplies and equipment. This will enable him to increase his sales and revenues. To do so, he and the other members of the group AYIDOTE6 are requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and machine accessories

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es: La señora Luz Adriana a sus 28 años de edad, se dedica junto con su esposo a realizar artesanías en madera desde su casa. Todo empezó cuando realizaron juntos por primera vez una alcancía y luego otros artículos para su hogar como mesas y repisas. El conocimiento lo adquirió de su esposo quien anteriormente trabajaba en una ebanistería. La señora Luz Adriana desea amortizar la deuda del activo adquirido en una maquina caladora y comprar material de trabajo como madera. La señora Luz Adriana sueña con tener su propio taller que le permita brindarle a su hijo de 5 años y esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luz Adriana, 28, makes wooden crafts alongside her husband at home.  Everything started when they first built a piggy bank and then other items for the home like tables and shelves.  She learned this skill from her husband who used to work as a cabinet maker.  Luz Adriana wants to pay off the debt she incurred when she purchased a boring machine and to buy work materials like wood.  Luz Adriana dreams with having her own workshop that will allow her to provide her five-year-old son and her husband with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay off a debt and to buy raw materials like wood.

loans.name: Castulo

texts.es:
Cástulo es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, tiene 68 años. El tiene una Zapatería en el barrio de esa ciudad, está casado con la Sra. Guillermina de 70 años quien es modista. Tiene 3 hijas, la mayor es Hilda de 36 años, Rosalba y Cinthia, todas ya casadas y con una profesión.
Don Cástulo desde que terminó la secundaria empezó con el negocio de la zapatería de lo que ya han pasado aproximadamente 50 años desde sus comienzos. Comenta que le va muy bien, puesto que ya tiene mucha experiencia y una clientela bien formada.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de cueros, cuerinas, clavitos y demás insumos para la zapatería, pues cuenta con mucha demanda de calzados para la temporada.
texts.en:
Cástulo is from the city of Paraguarí; he’s 68 years old.  He has a shoe shop in one of the city’s neighborhoods.  He’s married to Guillermina, 70, who is a dressmaker.  He has three daughters.  The oldest is Hilda, 36, and there is also Rosalba and Cinthia; they are all married and have professions.

Cástulo started in the shoe shop business when he finished secondary school about 50 years ago.  He comments that he does very well because he already had much experience and a well-formed clientele.  He’s asking for a loan to buy leather, faux leather, little nails and other supplies needed for the shoe shop because he has a lot of demand for seasonal footwear.

loans.use: to buy shoe making supplies.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: Lucio, de 41 años es un padre ejemplar. Vive en compañía de Marisol, su esposa desde hace 22 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Los Libertadores de Huari. Su principal actividad económica es la ganadería, en todo este tiempo pudo obtener muchos animales y ser conocido entre los habitantes de su pueblo, como un hombre trabajador y responsable. Entre los animales que posee se encuentran ovejas, vacas, llamas y caballos; los cuales cuida con mucho esmero. Cuenta que una vez a la semana, cuando llegan los compradores, vende un ejemplar de sus animales, ganando 100 nuevos soles como mínimo. Ahora desea aumentar más su ganado y así juntar buen capital. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “galpón al éxito” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Lucio de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias ovejas para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Lucio, 41, is an exemplary father.  He lives with Marisol, his wife of 22 years.  They have four children together that they care for in their own house located in the outskirts of Los Libertadores in Huari.  His main economic activity is raising livestock.  In time he’s managed to acquire quite a number of animals and to become very well known among the town’s residents as a hardworking, responsible man.  Among the animals he owns are sheep, cows, llamas and horses which he cares for very diligently.  He relates that once a week when buyers arrive he sells one of his animals earning at least 100 new soles.  Now, he wants to increase his herd size and gather good capital.

He belongs to the “Galpón al Éxito” communal bank and this is the first MFP loan.  He is grateful for the support he gets because it permits him to make progress with his business.  In addition, he pledges to be punctual with his payments because his communal bank is composed of responsible, mutually supportive people.  If Lucio were to receive your support, he will use the money to buy several sheep to increase his herd size.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Debido a que se termino la temporada de calor a la señora Margarita le está haciendo falta surtirse de ropa de invierno ya que es lo que le piden sus compradores por lo cual está solicitando este crédito para invertir en la compra de ropa de invierno. 
Doña Margarita es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad y a quienes les quiere dar lo mejor, para su futuro. Desea tener mas mercancía para ofrecer y que su negocio tenga mas ganancias.
texts.en: Due to the fact that the hot season is over, Margarita needs to stock up on winter clothes because her customers are requesting it already; this is why she’s asking for the loan to buy winter clothes.  Margarita is a single mother; she has three children in her care that she wants to provide the best for.  She wants to have more merchandise to offer so that her business will earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Ninoska

texts.es: Ninoska, de 20 años es una hija ejemplar. Vive en compañía de sus padres y 3 hermanos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Hualahoyo. A pesar de su corta edad, siempre fue independiente. La agricultura, fue desde niña su principal actividad, ya cuando creció, comenzó a sembrar en sociedad con campesinos que tenían sus propios terrenos de cultivo, lo que más siembra es papa y maíz. Con las ganancias que obtiene puede pagar sus estudios técnicos en computación, que es su principal meta. Pero como hija responsable, también vende ropa variada para hombres, mujeres y niños; que ofrece a los habitantes de su zona, ya tiene clientes fijos, eso le permite generar más dinero y así cuidar también a su familia. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Nonoska de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para sus sembríos de papa y maíz.
texts.en:
Ninoska, 20, is an exemplary daughter.  She lives with her parents and three siblings that she cares for in her own house located in Hualahoyo.  Despite her young age she’s always been independent.  Since she was a little girl she’s been farming and now that she’s grown up she started to plant in partnership with some farmers who own their fields.  What she plants the most is potatoes and corn.  With profits obtained she’s able to pay for her technical computer course which is her main goal.  But, like a responsible daughter, she also sells assorted clothing for men, women and children among her neighbors; she has regular customers and this allows her to generate more money to care for her family.

This is the first MFP loan; she is grateful for the support she gets because it allows her to progress with her business.  She promises to be punctual with her payments because her communal bank is composed of responsible, mutually supportive people.  If Ninoska were to get your support, she will use the requested money to buy natural fertilizer for her potato and corn crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: Elida, de 19 años es una hija responsable. Vive en compañía de sus padres en la localidad de Hualahoyo.  Ella tiene 2 pasiones, una es el tejido y la otra sus estudios de Administración de empresas. Ya le falta muy poco para que termine su carrera, lo cual hace posible gracias al tejido de gorras y bolsos, sus clientes le hacen grandes pedidos durante el año. Por lo que agradece a Dios, pues nunca le hace falta trabajo. Además en temporadas de siembra de papa, aprovecha para ganar un dinero extra, porque busca socios para que así pueda ganar dinero. Ahora quiere incursionar en la elaboración de adornos navideños para vender. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Elida, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Elida, 19, is a responsible daughter.  She lives with her parents in Hualahoyo.  She has two passions: knitting and her business administration courses.  She’s very close to finishing her career which is made possible thanks to her knitting caps and purses; her customers place large orders throughout the year.  She thanks God because there’s always work.  In addition, she takes advantage of potato planting season to earn extra money because she looks for members to earn money with.  Now, she wants to go into the Christmas decorations business.

This is the first MFP loan; she is grateful for the support she receives because it will help her make business progress.  She promises to be punctual with her payments because her communal bank is composed of responsible and mutually supportive people.  If Elida were to receive your support, she will use the money to buy natural fertilizers for her potato crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Marjorie Del Rocio

texts.es:
Marjorie de 33 años, con la ayuda de Dios a podido salir adelante en su negocio, hasta ahora a podido agrandar mas su pequeña papelería y confitería, vendiendo artículos de bazar.

Hasta ahora su problema sigue siendo la delincuencia ya que el sector en que vive es peligroso.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar papeleria, confiteria etc. Sigue felizmente casa y gracias a Dios sus hijos están bien y siguen estudiando. Con el préstamo que adquiera quiere seguir ampliando mas su negocio.
texts.en: Marjorie, 33, with God’s help has managed to get ahead with her business.  To date, she’s been able to enlarge her small stationery and sweet shop adding gift items to sell.  To date, her problem continues to be crime since the neighborhood she lives in is dangerous.  She wants to use the loan to buy stationery items, sweets, etc.  She continues happily married and, thanks to God, her children are well and continue studying.  With the loan she gets she wants to continue expanding her business more.

loans.use: to buy gift items, stationery items and sweets.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La señora Luz Marina a sus 50 años de edad, es una emprendedora, quien desea iniciar un negocio de producción y venta de arepas, el cual le comprará a una amiga. La señora Luz Marina años atrás trabajó con su familia en un negocio de arepas, por lo cual cuenta con experiencia en este oficio. La señora Luz Marina desea comprar el montaje de la fábrica de arepas compuesto por dos asadores, un fogón de gas, dos ollas grandes, un molino, y una moto para los domicilios. Con lo anterior la señora Luz Marina mejoraría la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Luz Marina, 50, is an entrepreneur who wants to start her own business making arepas [a flat, round, unleavened patty made of cornmeal or flour which can be grilled, baked, boiled, or fried] to sell; she will buy it from a friend.  Years ago Luz Marina worked with her family in an arepa business so she has experience in this line of work. Luz Marina wants to buy the essentials needed to set up an arepa factory which consists of two grills, a gas stove, two large pots, a mill and a motorcycle for home deliveries.  With this Luz Marina will improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to set up an arepa sales business.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Iv Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre Maria Auxiliadora IV, se conformo, gracias a la Sra. Leonora, quien ya había formado parte D. otro grupo,  que al desintegrarse  el grupo, decidió formar un nuevo grupo en su barrio, actualmente son  14  mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el cuarto ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Es un grupo que se destaca por trabajo en conjunto y solidario que realizan.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Carla, quien se dedica a la venta D. joyas D. todo tipo, como ser anillos, cadenas, pulseras, aros y demás. Comenta que gracias a la simpatía que tiene, sumada a la hermosa calidad D. sus joyas ha podido hacerse D. una clientela considerable.
Ella solicita la ayuda D. la fundación y D. kiva, para la compra D. anillos, cadenas, pulseras, tobilleras y demás tipos D. joyas para abastecerse y D. esa forma cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women’s committee called “María Auxiliadora IV” was formed thanks to Leonora who had previously belonged to a different group.  When that group disbanded, she decided to form a new on in her neighborhood.  It currently has 14 members, women who are already working comfortably in their fourth cycle together and in a mutually supportive way in the program.  This group stands out for their mutually supportive teamwork.

One of the members is Carla who sells all types of jewelry like rings, chains, bracelets, hoops and others.  She comments that thanks to her pleasant personality added to the beautiful quality of her jewelry she’s been able to acquire a significant clientele.

She is asking for help from the Fundación and from Kiva to buy rings, chains, bracelets, anklets and other types of jewelry to stock up and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 48 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past four years, Joy has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Joy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Joy to generate greater profits, which will help her pay the school fees for her children. Joy hopes that in the future she will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Joy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Joy, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Oluwatchehoun Group

texts.fr: OLUWATCHEHOUN est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Winsi Rosaline. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin et fréquentent la même Eglise. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la cinquième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Winsi Rosaline est âgée de 51 ans et est mariée à Victorin, un ferrailleur. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur  charge. En plus des deux enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge.Winsi Rosaline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Winsi Rosaline a arrêté l'école au cours primaire. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Winsi Rosaline vend depuis une trentaine d'année, des vêtements et divers autres articles de façon secondaire. Winsi Rosaline s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Ce cinquième prêt permettra certainement à Winsi Rosaline et à aux autres membres du groupe OLUWATCHEHOUN, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
OLUWATCHEHOUN is a group comprised of three persons whose representative (with her hand raised in the photo) is named Winsi Rosaline. The group members live in the same district in Benin and attend the same church. With the goal of increasing their working capital, they are requesting a loan from ALIDé for the fifth time. 

Winsi Rosaline is 51 years old and married to Victorin, a scrap metal merchant. They have two children, both in school and in their care. In addition to these two children, the couple has another child to support. Winsi Rosaline lives together with her children and husband, and the couple jointly cover the diverse family expenses. 

Winsi Rosaline dropped out of primary school. To meet her needs and those of her children, she has been selling clothing and a variety of other goods for about thirty years. Her supplies come from a city in Benin. 

This fifth loan will surely enable Winsi Rosaline and the other members of the group OLUWATCHEHOUN to boost their business and to increase their customer base and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy clothing (for infants, etc.)

loans.name: Liboria Feliza

texts.es:
Liboria de 34 años, Con las fuerzas que le da Dios Trabaja como empleada domestica en una casa. 
No tiene horarios fijos para trabajar, y el único problema que se le presenta es la delincuencia que observa cuando va de su casa al trabajo.

Esta felizmente unida con su esposo y no tienen hijos. Con su prestamo quiere comprar cemento, arena, bloques para construir mejor su casa. Su meta es poder terminar de construir su casa por el cual solicitaron el préstamo.
texts.en: Liboria, 34, with God’s strength, works as a domestic employee in a house.  She does not have fixed work schedules.  The only problem she faces is crime she observes going to and coming home from work.  She is happily united to her husband; they have no children.  She wants to use her loan to buy cement, sand and concrete blocks to better build her house.  Her goal is to be able to finish building the house and this is why they asked for the loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, concrete blocks and sand.

loans.name: Manda Muungano Group

texts.en:
Samuel is the facilitator of the Manda Muungano group. Samuel and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Samuel takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Samuel had a good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Samuel was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Samuel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Samuel will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Manda Muungano group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es: Con su anterior crédikiva Xiomara compró queso, productos de panadería que vendió y se encuentra muy satisfecha porque logró reinvertir este nuevo capital. En la actualidad se prepara para recibir su nuevo credikiva, el cual invertirá en queso especialmente, porque se acercan las fiestas de fin de año, temporada de gran repunte en sus ventas, debido a que las familias aumentan el consumo de este producto, que es la base de la preparacion de deliciosas comidas y es usado tambien como pasabocas de las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo. Su mensjae a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente:" Gracias por apoyarme y mi retribución  será cancelar en forma puntual la obligación."
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Xiomara bought cheese and baked goods which she sold. She is very satisfied because she was able to reinvest this loan. She is now ready for her next Kiva loan. She will invest it particularly in cheese because the New Year is coming up, and she always has very good sales at this time, because families consume cheese more at this time of year. This is because cheese is the base for many delicious foods, and it is also used as finger food during Christmas and New Year's parties. She has the following message for Kiva lenders:
"Thank you for supporting me. In return, I will be punctual with my repayments."

loans.use: to buy cheese and baked goods.

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr: Monsieur Aliou vit au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 24 ans. Il est marié et père d’un enfant d’un an. Il est commerçant  et évolue dans ce secteur depuis plus de 10 ans. Son activité consiste à vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires des habits de femmes. C’est une activité qu’il a choisi par passion  et il s’intéresse  beaucoup  aux revenus que lui procure son activité. Il est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis septembre 2010. Il a déjà remboursé  un prêt antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’habits  de femmes destinés a la vente. Son objectif est d’élargir son activité et accroitre ses bénéfices pour améliorer ses conditions de vie sociale.
texts.en: Mr. Aliou lives in Senegal. He is 24 years old. He is a married father of a one-year-old child. He is a merchant and has been in this sector for over ten years. His business consists of selling women’s clothing in weekly markets. It’s a business he chose from passion and he is very interested in the revenues he makes in this business. He has been a member of the UIMCEC bank since September 2010. He has already repaid a previous loan. He is seeking a loan for 300,000 frs to buy women’s clothing to sell. His objective is to increase his business and his earnings to improve the conditions of his social life.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing to resell

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr:
Arame est mariée, âgée de 40 ans et mère de 6 enfants, elle membre du banc villageois depuis le 06/08/2009.
Elle fait partie du groupe de solidarité Diamaguene.

Le petit commerce constitue son activité plus précisément la vente de poissons fumés et séchés.
Avec son nouveau prêt Arame va acheter 50 paniers de poissons séchés , 2 paniers de poissons fumés qu'elle va revendre.

A l'aide de ses bénéfices Madame va aider son mari dans la prise en charge sanitaire et scolaire de ses enfants.
mais également elle  va acheter du riz de l'huile et du sucre pour tout la famille à la fin de chaque mois.
texts.en: Arame is married, 40 years old and the mother of six children. She is a member of the "banc villageois" (village bank) since August 6th, 2009. She is part of the Diamaguene group. Local trade is her business activity, more specifically the sale of smoked and dried fish. With her new loan, Arame will buy 50 baskets of dried fish and 2 baskets of smoked fish which she will re-sell. With the help of her profits, she will help her husband in taking care of the basic health and education needs of her children; however she will also buy rice, oil and sugar for the whole family at the end of each month.

loans.use: to buy fish products (smoked and dried fish)

loans.name: Ismary Yessenia

texts.es:
La señora Ismary tiene 35 años y vive en La Rosa, un barrio que pertenece al municipio de Yoro. Ismary es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos: una niña de 12 y un niño de 5 años de edad. La niña está asistiendo a la escuela. 

Hace 12 años Ismary empezó una pulpería con esfuerzos propios. A través de los años ella ha mantenido bien el negocio. Trabaja todo el día en la pulpería, la cual está ubicada dentro de su casa. Ismary comenta que su casa está en la esquina del parque de la comunidad y que no hay pulperías cerca. Puso el negocio para dar un mejor servicio a la comunidad y para superarse. Ofrece una variedad de productos como arroz, azúcar, manteca, cafe, refrescos, jugos, pan, churros, sal, cubitos, sopa, y huevos entre otros. 

Ismary tiene la visión de ampliar sus ventas y convertir la pulpería en un mini-bodega. Solicitó este crédito de L20,000 para surtir su inventario con la compra de refrescos, manteca, churros, huevos y otros productos. Con las ganancias, Ismary espera educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Ismary is 35 years old and lives in La Rosa, a neighborhood in the town of Yoro.  Ismary is a single mother with two children; a 12-year-old daughter and a 5-year-old son.  Her daughter attends school.

Twelve years ago, Ismary opened a convenience store through her own efforts.  Over the years, she has been able to keep the business going well.  She works every day in the convenience store, which is located in her home.  Ismary comments that her home is on a corner of the community park, and there aren't any other convenience stores nearby.  She started the business in order to provide a service to the community, and to be able to move ahead in life.  She offers a variety of products for sale, such as rice, sugar, butter, coffee, sodas, juice, bread, churros (fritters), salt, ice-cubes, soup, and eggs among other things.

Ismary has a vision of expanding her sales and converting her convenience store to a mini-market.  She is requesting this credit of L20,000 to stock up on inventory by purchasing sodas, butter, churros, eggs, and other products.   With the profits, Ismary hopes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, butter, churros (fritters), eggs and other products.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es: Raymundo, de 18 años es un joven responsable. Vive en compañía de su mamá Juliana, su papá Fortunato y su hermano Gabriel en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Los Libertadores de Huari. Como buen hijo, él trabaja para ayudar en los gastos del hogar y también para ahorrar en su futuro. De lunes a viernes durante todo el día, trabaja en una mina de cobre por su localidad. Ahí percibe un salario mensual que le permite mantener la estabilidad de su hogar. Además cría carneros, vacas, llamas y alpacas, la actividad económica de su familia. Cuenta que en temporadas de escases, cuando no tiene trabajo, es la venta de sus animales lo que le brinda el soporte económico que necesita. Su principal meta es aumentar la cantidad de sus animales, pues ahí tiene ahorrado el capital que requiere para abrir un negocio propio. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “galpón al éxito” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Raymundo de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 10 ovejas para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Raymundo, age 18, is a responsible young man. He lives with his mother, Juliana; his father, Fortunato; and his brother, Gabriel, in their own home in Los Libertadores de Huari. Like a good son, he works in order to help out with the household costs and also to save up for his future. He works all day, Monday to Friday, in a local copper mine. He receives a stable monthly salary for his household. He and his family also raise rams, cows, llamas, and alpacas. He says that in times of shortages, when he doesn't have work, the sales of their animals provides the economic income that his family needs. His main goal is to increase the number of animals that they have. He has some money saved up to open his own business.
He belongs to the “Galpón al éxito” communal bank, and this is his first loan with MFP. He is grateful for the support that he is receiving; this will allow him to move forward with his business. He promises to be punctual with the payment of his quotas. The members of his bank are responsible and united.
Upon receiving your support, Raymundo will invest in the purchase of 10 sheep to increase their flock.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep.

loans.name: Ledis Maria

texts.es: Ledis  con su anterior credikiva compró equipos para ampliar su infraestructura de servicios, así es como hoy tiene un televisor y un play Station más y atiende una mayor demanda. Su meta es continuar invirtiendo en juegos novedosos para atraer a sus clientes un televisor más, porque aprovechará que no tiene competencia en el sector y esta es la razón de su nuevo credikiva.  Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: “Gracias   por el apoyo  para así salir adelante, además nos ayudarán a crecer cada día mas como persona y como microempresaria.”
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Ledis bought equipment to expand her service infrastructure. Now, she has one more TV and Play Station, and she serves more customers. Her goal is to keep investing in new games in order to attract more customers. She wants to invest in another TV. She takes advantage of the fact that she has no competition. This is why she is taking out a loan.
She would like to send the following message to Kiva lenders:
"Thank you for your support so that I can get ahead. You will help us to grow daily, as people and as businesspeople."

loans.use: To buy two more television sets and two PlayStations

loans.name: Sonia Doranny

texts.es: La señora Sonia a sus 28 años de edad es madre de tres hijos de 12, 7 y 9 años de edad, se dedica a la producción agropecuaria. Desde niña, la señora Sonia ha trabajado la agricultura y actualmente tiene un vivero de flores. La señora Sonia desea diversificar su negocio adquiriendo cerdos para su cría y levante; asimismo desea construir el lugar donde permanecerían los cerdos llamado cochera. Con lo anterior podrán aumentar sus ingresos familiares y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño de la señora Sonia es tener una gran finca en la que pueda tener muchos cultivos.
texts.en: At the age of 28, Mrs. Sonia is the mother of three children, ages 9, 7 and 12. She has worked in agriculture since she was a child. She now has a flower nursery. Sonia wants to diversify her business and buy hogs to raise. She also wants to build a shed for them to live in. With this investment she will be able to increase her family's income and improve their quality of life. Mrs. Sonia's dream is to have a big farm with a lot of crops.

loans.use: to buy hogs and build a place for them to live.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Esperanza nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras, luchadoras y emprendedoras.
La Sra.Fatima es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la costura, trabajo gracias al cual ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ella comenta que siempre está muy abarrotada de trabajo, lo cual le viene muy bien, pues la ayuda a tener mejores ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, cierres, botones y demás insumos necesarios para abastecer su taller. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues e una gran oportunidad para ellas.
texts.en:
The Esperanza (Hope) Communal Bank emerged due to the effort and support of Ciudad de San Lorenzo, another communal bank that was working in the same community. This Communal Bank is from San Lorenzo city and its main objective is for each one of its members to achieve growth. They are locally known as hard-working, resolute and entrepreneurial women. 
Fatima is one member of this bank. Working as a seamstress, she has been able to get through in life and support her family. She says she always has lots of work and she is grateful for that since that makes her income grow.
She is asking for this loan to purchase textiles, threads, zippers, buttons and other materials for her workshop. She thanks the institution for the opportunity given, because she considers this to be a great opportunity for all the members.

loans.use: purchase textiles, threads, zippers, buttons and other inputs.

loans.name: Sinoko Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sinoko Group in Western Kenya! Leah is the facilitator of the Sinoko group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Leah takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Leah had a good maize yield harvesting eight bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Leah was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Leah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Leah will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sinoko group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lukova Group

texts.en:
Joshua is the facilitator of the Lukova group. Joshua and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Joshua had a very good maize yield harvesting seven bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joshua was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joshua and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Joshua will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Lukova group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Jalia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells electronics. 

To help expand her business, Jalia has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more electronic supplies for resale, and will help Jalia to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Jalia hopes that in the future she will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Jalia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Jalia, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more electronic supplies for resale.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira, de 47 años es una mujer trabajadora. Tuvo 4 hijos de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellas en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Hualahoyo. Ella consiguió muchas cosas gracias a la agricultura. Una de ellas es; una tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad para los habitantes de su zona. Además de bebidas, carnes y guisantes para la preparación de los alimentos. Ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a esto, sus principales sembríos constan de maíz y papa, los que realiza en terrenos arrendados, pues no cuenta con unos propios. Ahora su principal meta es adquirir el dinero necesario para adquirir una hectárea propia y de esa manera abastecer la comercialización en la capital del país donde vende sus cosechas. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Elvira de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próximo sembrío de papa en 2 hectáreas de terreno productivo.
texts.en: Elvira, 47, is a working woman. She had 4 children of which only 2 live with her in own home, located in the town of Hualahoyo. She achieved many things through agriculture. One is, a grocery store, where she sells basic necessities for people in her area, also drinks, meat and peas for food preparation. She has done this for 20 years; her main crops consist of corn and potatoes, which she grows on leased land since she does not have her own. Now her main goal is to get the money needed to acquire her own acre and thus supply the market in the capital of the country where she sells crops. This is the fourth loan with MFP, where she appreciates the support she receives, since it allows her to move forward in her business. She promises to be timely with her loan payments, since their association is made up of responsible and caring people. Elvira, having their support, will invest the money she is requesting to purchase natural fertilizers for her next sowing of potatoes in 2 hectares of productive land.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materiales to develop women's footwear.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son D. la Cuidad D. Caacupé, son personas muy trabajadoras, ellas están muy agradecidas con la fundación porque gracias a las facilidades D. los créditos ellas pueden acceder a él y D. ese modo invertir en sus negocios y D. esa forma ir creciendo D. a poco para poder ayudar a sus hijos y familiares. Ellas desean llegar al máximo ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras, es por ello que trabajan duro.
La presidenta es la Sra. Myrian, quien vive con su marido e hijos en su humilD. casa en la ciudad D. Caacupé. Ella se dedica a la venta D. lencería, trabajo que la ha ayudado a aportar con los gastos D. la casa y D. esa forma contribuir con su marido. Ella junto con sus compañeras realizan constantes actividades para que D. ese modo puedan fomentar la integración entre las compañeras y tratar D. adelantar sus cuotas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. lencerías, tanto masculinas como femeninas, pues estas son el producto principal D. su negocio.
texts.en: The women of this Committee are from the city of Caacupé and are very hard workers.  They are very grateful with the Foundation because, thanks to the ease of the loans they can access and invest in their business, they grow little by little to help their children and families. They want to reach the maximum cycle of the program of women entrepreneurs, which is why they work hard. The President is Mrs. Myrian, who lives with her husband and children in her humble home in the city of Caacupé. She sells lingerie, work which has helped proviD. for the expenses of the house and thus helping her husband. She and her partners maD. constant efforts together, so that in this way, can foster integration between the partners and try to advance their quotas.  She is requesting a loan for the purchase of lingerie, both male and female, because these are the main product of her business.

loans.use: to buy lingerie for resale.

loans.name: Lucha

texts.es: Lucha, de 23 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Walter, su esposo desde hace 16 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Ruth, Michel y André en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de Chilca. Estar ocupada es su mejor terapia. Pues gusta de ser independiente y ganar por ella misma sus ingresos. Es así que durante las mañanas trabaja en un centro de estimulación temprana para niños de 3 a 5 años, estar con los niños le gusta mucho, ahí recibe un sueldo mensual. Ya por las tardes vende ropa de toda ocasión a sus vecinos ya su pariente de Acostambo, donde visita una vez a la semana, ya que cuida de sus cultivos de papa y maíz que siembra en temporadas. Ahora desea juntar dinero para comprar su propia casa, sabe que lo logrará con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja como albañil construyendo casas. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “el vencedor” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Lucha de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 200 a 300 kilos de semilla de cebada para su próximo sembrío.
texts.en: Lucha is a 23-year-old working woman. She lives with Walter, her husband of 16 years, their three children: Ruth, Michel and André in a rented house in the town of Chilca. Being busy is her best therapy. Because she likes to be independent and earn her own income, she works during the mornings in an early learning center for children from 3 to 5 years old; she loves being with the children, then receiving a monthly salary. In the evenings, she sells clothes for every occasion to her neighbors, already selling her relatives of Acostambo, where she visits once a week, to look after her crops of potatoes and corn planting seasons. Now she wants to raise money to buy her own house.  She knows that she can achieve it with the support of her husband who works as a bricklayer building houses. She belongs to the solidarity group "the winner" and this is her second loan with MFP, where she appreciates the support she receives since it allows her to make progress in her business.  She promises to be timely with the loan repayments since the association is made up of responsible and caring people. Lucha, for her support, will invest the money requested in the purchase of 200 to 300 kilos of barley seed for her next sowing.

loans.use: to buy 300 kilos of barley seed.

loans.name: Maria Eloisa

texts.es:
Maria de 48 años, tiene un restaurante el cual trabaja sola todos los días de 6 am hasta las 10 pm, le ha ido muy bien y ahora también se dedica a la venta de víveres al por menor.

El único problema que presenta es que su sector es muy peligroso y su miedo es la delincuencia.

Es madre soltera y trabaja para salir adelante con sus dos hijas de 12 y 10 años que estudian en escuela fiscal.

Su meta es terminar de construir su casa y poder decorar su comedor para la mejora atención y conformidad de sus clientes.
texts.en: Maria, 48, has a restaurant where she works alone every day from 6 am until 10 pm.  It has gone well for her and now she also sells food retail. The only problem is that their sector is very dangerous and her fear is crime. She is a single mother and works to move ahead with her two daughters, 12 and 10, studying in public school. Her goal is to finish building her house and to decorate her dining room to improve care and comfort of her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and other food.

loans.name: Jitegemee Group

texts.en:
