Greetings from Jitegemee Group in Western Kenya!  Mary is the facilitator of the Jitegemee group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mary takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Mary will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Jitegemee group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Diégane

texts.fr: Monsieur Diégane vit au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 42 ans. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants de 10 mois et 8 ans. Il est agent de  dans une société de gardiennage  qui assure la sécurité des différents guichets de l’U-IMCEC. Il sert dans l’un des guichets de l’IMCEC  ou il est membre depuis  novembre  2006.Auparavant il était cultivateur et c’est sous l’influence d’un de ses amis  qu’il s’est retrouvé dans le secteur du gardiennage. Ce qui l’intéresse néanmoins ce sont les connaissances qu’il  noue avec la population et aussi les revenus que lui procure l’activité. Il a déjà remboursé 5 prêts antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour la fabrication de briques et la continuation du bâtiment   qu’il  est en train de construire  progressivement au village.
texts.en: Mr. Diégane lives in Senegal. He is 42 years old. He is a married father of two children, who are 10 months and 8 years old. He is an agent at a security company who provides security for different UIMCEC banks. He works at one of the IMCEC banks, where he has been a member since November 2006. Before that, he was a farmer, and it was the influence of one of his friends that he moved into the security sector. What interests him, however, is the people he meets and also the income he makes. He has already repaid 5 previous loans with the institution. He is seeking a loan of 200,000 frs for making bricks and the continuation of the building that he is in the middle of gradually building in the village.

loans.use: to make bricks

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar, de 37 años es un hombre hábil. Vive en compañía de Rosalina, su esposa desde hace 7 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Tania, Cintia y Nicol, a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Conopa. El trabajo al que se dedica es la agricultura, sus principales sembríos son de Habas, trigo y cebada; los que cuida por ocasiones, pues alquila un cuarto en la ciudad, donde sus hijos viven; pues ellos estudian ahí. Pero como él tiene terrenos propios en su pueblo y ya es conocido, pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo ahí. Además cuida de sus animales como vacas, cerdos y burros que vende cuando ya están maduros. Hace poco incursionó en la venta de agregados como arena fina, gruesa, piedra y demás. Cuenta que ahí le va muy bien, tanto así que piensa invertir más para aprovechar el buen negocio que tiene. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “el vencedor” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Oscar de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas para preparar el terreno a la espera de sus sembríos de habas y cebada.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 37, is a skilled man. He lives with Rosalina, his wife of seven years. They have three children: Tania, Cintia and Nicol. They live in their own home in Conopa. Oscar works in agriculture. His main crops are beans, wheat and barley. He also rents a room in the city, where his children live; they study there. But since he has his own lands in his village and is already known as a farmer, he spends most of his time there. He also cares for animals such as cows, hogs, and donkeys, which he sells once they are grown. He also recently started selling items such as fine sand, coarse sand, stones, and other such items.
He tells us that it has been going very well for him, so he plans to invest more in order to get the most out of his business. He belongs to the "El Vencedor" ["The Victor"] communal bank, and this is his first loan with MFP. He is grateful for the support that he is receiving; it will allow him to progress with his business. He also promises to be punctual with the payment of his quotas. His bank is made up of responsible and united people. Upon receiving your support, Oscar will invest the requested money in the purchase of tools for preparing his land in preparation for sowing beans and barley.

loans.use: to buy agricultural tools.

loans.name: Noe Efrain

texts.es:
El señor Noe Efrain  es  casado, tiene 49 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijo el cual no esta estudiando, se dedica a la elaboración de muebles, de diferente clases: sillas mesas, roperos y entre otros, inicio este trabajo hace 13 años y tiene buena experiencia.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de madera de pino blanco y pino colorado, e incrementar su producción, espera en el futuro ver una mueblería grande.
texts.en:
Mr. Noe Efrain is married, 49, and did not have the opportunity to study. He has one child who is not in school. Noe Efrain makes various kinds of furniture: tables, chairs, wardrobes, and other items. He started this work 13 years ago and is now well-experienced.
He is requesting a loan which he will use to buy white and coloured pine wood, to increase production. He hopes to be a major furniture maker in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood for making furniture.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 36 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Esther has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar and soap for resale, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Esther who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es: Enriqueta, de 32 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Raúl, su esposo desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos todos ellos menores de edad a los que cuidan en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de Chilca. Gracias a su habilidad, puede salir adelante. Su principal oficio es la venta de comida china en una pequeña carpa que instaló en el mercado de la ciudad. Ahí obtiene buenas ganancias, pues en las mañanas aprovecha en vender queso, asimismo en temporadas de festividad se las ingenia para vender accesorios de ocasión “trabajo en todo”, afirma. Además su esposo e hijo mayor, son taxistas, con ello lleva un dinero extra al hogar. Ahora desea aprovechar la campaña navideña para obtener mayores ingresos y así juntar dinero para comprar su casa propia. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “el vencedor” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Enriqueta de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de luces, inciensos, flores aromáticas para vender en navidad.
texts.en: Enriqueta, age 32, is a hard-working woman. She lives with Raul, her husband of 17 years. Together they have four young children and live in a rented home in Chilca. Thanks to her skill, she has been able to get ahead. Her main job is selling Chinese food in a small stall which she established in a market in the city. She makes a good income, and in the mornings she sells cheese. During the holiday season, she works creatively to sell seasonal items. "I take every opportunity to work", she confirms. Her husband and oldest son work as taxi drivers, and bring in extra money for the household. Now, she wants to take advantage of the Christmas season to make more money in order to build their own home. She belongs to the "El Vencedor" ["The Victor"] communal bank, and this is her first loan with MFP. She is grateful for the support that she will receive; this will allow her to move forward with her business. She promises to be punctual in paying her quotas. Her communal bank is made up of responsible and united people. Upon receiving your support, Enriqueta will invest in the purchase of lights, incense, and scented flowers to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy incense, scented flowers and Christmas lights.

loans.name: Sirende Group

texts.en:
Esther is the facilitator of the Sirende group. Esther and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Esther takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to grow enough to feed her family and in order to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Esther had a very good maize yield, harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Esther was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on ½  acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Esther and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Esther will build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sirende group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land. Esther is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ablowoa

texts.fr:
Ablowoa est un homme âgé de 51 ans. Elle est mariée å un retraité. Elle a  03 enfants. Le premier a 30 ans et le dernier a 24 ans.  
Ablowoa travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale  depuis 2003. Elle vend dans une boutique à la maison après s’être approvisionner à Lomé.
Ablowoa a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générales. Il veut agrandir son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ablowoa voudrait ajouter d’autres activités comme la vente des céréales. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Ablowoa, age 51, is married to a retiree. She has three children, the oldest is 30 and the youngest is 24.

Since 2003, she's been working as a reseller of grocery products. She gets her supplies in Lomé, and sells in a small shop at her home.

Ablowoa is seeking her third loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy grocery products. She wants to expand her business.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to start selling cereals. She says that she intends to use her profits to cover her family's vital needs.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Jepopyhy Group

texts.es:
18 mujeres del Chaco se han unido con el objetivo de procurar mayores ingresos por medio del trabajo en equipo, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que día a día luchan por darle lo mejor a sus familias. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación.
Una de estas mujeres es la señora Eva, quien se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, como ser: fideos, arroz, verduras, y demás, con lo cual surte a su vecindario y de paso obtiene el ingreso para ayudar a su familia. Ella desea algún día tener un negocio amplio y con más capacidad.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de fideos, arroz, verduras, y demás productos con los cuales podrá abastecerse y de esa forma cumplir con la demanD. de sus clientes.
texts.en:
18 women from Chaco have joined together with the goal of making a better income by working together. They are very hard-working and enterprising women who fight every day to give their families the best. They are currently in their first cycle in the female entrepreneurs' programme with Fundación.
One of these woman is Mrs. Eva. She sells basic staples such as: pasta, rice, and vegetables. With this store, she makes an income to support her family. She wants to have a large business one day. She is requesting this loan to purchase pasta, rice, vegetables, and other products so that she can stock up and cover her customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy pasta, rice, and vegetables to stock her business.

loans.name: Germán Santos

texts.es:
el señor German Santos es casado, tiene 28 años de edad, es perito contador, tiene un hijo pequeño, se dedica a presta servicios profesionales para una empresa, como contador, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para cubrir gastos personales, para la compra de comida, para realización de una fiesta, para celebrar el cumpleaños de su hijo, espera mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Germán Santos, aged 28, is married and the father of a young son. He is a qualified accountant and offers professional services to a company. He is supported by his wife who does the household chores.

Germán applies for a loan to cover personal expenses. He will buy food for his son's birthday party. He hopes to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

loans.use: to cover personal expenses.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Solicita un préstamo para poder mejorar la apariencia de su negocio y al mismo tiempo atraer a mas clientes, ya que podrá dar otro servicios de estética, como poner uñas artificiales, aplicar tintes, etc. que antes no se podían ofrecer por falta de equipo; tanto como Don Francisco y su esposa se verán muy beneficiados con el crédito ya que es la fuente principal de ingresos para su familia. Entre el señor Francisco y su esposa son los que atienden el salón de belleza.
texts.en: Francisco is requesting a loan to improve the appearance of his business and attract more customers. He will be able to provide more services, such as artificial nails, tinting, etc., which he is currently unable to provide due to lack of funds. Francisco and his wife will benefit greatly from this loan, as this business is the main source of income for his family. Francisco and his wife tend to the salon.

loans.use: to buy equipment and furniture; tables, mirrors and chairs, for his beauty salon.

loans.name: Bess

texts.en:
Bess is 28 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, Bess has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Bess has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar and soap for resale, and will help Bess to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Bess hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Bess is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Bess who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Jikaze Group

texts.en:
Shaphani is the facilitator of the Jikaze group. Shaphani and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Shaphani takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Shaphani had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 11 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Shaphani was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Shaphani and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Shaphani will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Jikaze group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Demetria, de 35 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en compañía de sus 4 menores hijos, a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Orcotuna. El trabajo en el campo es su principal actividad económica. Durante las mañanas ordeña a las 5 vacas que posee, las cuales le brindan de 25 a 30 litros de leche, las que vende a buen precio, pues ya tiene clientela fija. Además siembra alfalfa en terrenos heredados, cuenta que siembra en grandes cantidades, las cuales le permiten obtener dinero pues vende todos los días en una esquina de su localidad, que coincide con la carretera, por lo que es muy visitada, al término del día llega a vender un promedio de 80 nuevos soles, “todo depende de los fardos que llegue a vender”, afirma. Asimismo el restante de alfalfa les sirve para alimento a sus vacas. Ahora desea vender alimentos como papa y verduras, ya que le piden sus clientes constantemente. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Demetria de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de papa “harinosa, blanca y amarilla”, y alfalfa por lotes  para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Demetria, 35, is a responsible woman. She lives with her 4 minor children, whom she is raising in her own home located in the town of Orcotuna. Her principal economic activity is farm work. During the mornings she cares for her 5 cows, which produce 25 to 30 liters of milk that she sells at a good price to an established clientele. As well she cultivates alfalfa on family land. She plants large quantities which she sells every day on a well traveled corner near the highway in her city, earning on average of about 80 nuevos soles a day. “It all depends on the number of bales that I have to sell,” she notes. She uses the leftover alfalfa to feed her cows.

Currently, Demetria wants to sell food such as potatoes and vegetables, since her customers constantly ask for them. This is her fourth loan from MFP and she is grateful for the help she has received which has allowed her to progress in her business. She promises to make her payments on time for her communal bank is made up of responsible and supportive people. Upon receiving your support Demetria will invest 
the money in the purchase of  “floury, white and yellow varieties” of potatoes and batches of alfalfa to supply her business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and alfalfa

loans.name: Hipatia

texts.es:
Hipatia de 35 años vive en el barrio La Playa donde se dedica a la confección en general y al desarrollo de productos de lencería, actividad que aprendió inspirada por sus familiares, quienes la enseñaron  a elaborar algunos adornos navideños  para fin de año y productos con apuntes exuberantes  para la temporada del carnaval.  En un principio lo hacía como su hobby, pero gradualmente, su actividad  fue cogiendo fuerza entre vecinos, amigos y particulares hasta convertirse en su principal generador de ingresos, que le permitió comprar su primera máquina familiar y empezar a ejercerla , formalizándola y agregando cada vez más nuevas máquinas. 
En la actualidad Hypatia disfruta mucho de su actividad, pues estaba cansada de ser empleada, es muy apasionada con lo que hace y por eso sus productos gozan de  buena calidad. Ella  cada día desea mejorar,  por eso estudió diseño de modas para perfeccionar su arte; también ha realizado cursos en diversas técnicas como la madera y otras manualidades, con lo que le agrega valor a sus productos y diversifica. Su negocio está ubicado en un espacio adecuado y bien organizado compra sus materiales e insumos en centros especializados para la confección;  su sistema de ventas  es a crédito y de contado y siempre mantiene un inventario de  muestras,  para que el cliente pueda seleccionar lo que le gusta y ayudar en un nuevo diseño.  En épocas de gran movimiento comercial es apoyada por  algunas personas, pero  la mayor parte del tiempo ella trabaja sola  y en horarios extensos.
En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará una fileteadora industrial , que mejorará  sus tiempos productivos, el acabado de las prendas y también invertirá  materiales e insumos, como telas rellenos y aplicaciones para que sus clientes encuentren en su negocio el mejor arreglo navideño y la más linda ropa para lucir en las fiestas .
texts.en:
Hipatia, 35, lives in La Playa barrio where she makes general clothing and has developed a line of lingerie, tasks inspired by and that she learned from relatives who also taught her how to make various Christmas and New Years decorations as well as flamboyant items for Carnival season. Initially she made things as a hobby but gradually her items began attracting buyers among neighbors, friends and individuals until this became her main source of income, which enabled her to purchase her first family-owned machine and begin to use it. Thus she began formalizing her business and gradually adding more new machines.

At present, Hipatia enjoys her business a great deal since she was tired of simply being an employee. She is very passionate about what she does and because of this her products are known for their high quality. She wants to improve every day and thus she studied fashion design in order to perfect her art. She has also taken courses using different materials such as wood and other handicrafts, in order to add value to her products and diversify. Her business is located in a suitable and well organized space. She buys her materials and supplies in specialized clothing centers. She sells on credit and for cash and always maintains an inventory of samples so that her customers can choose what they like and help create their own designs. During seasons when there is a great deal of business she hires people to help, however most of the time she works alone and for extended hours.

Currently she is applying for a loan from Kiva and this will be the first funding provided to her by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy an industrial threading machine, which will improve her production time in finishing her clothing items. She will also purchase materials and supplies, such as quilted fabrics and appliqués, so that her clients will find the best Christmas trimmings and the prettiest clothes to wear during the holidays.

loans.use: to buy an industrial threading machine and materials and supplies such as quilted fabrics and appliqués.

loans.name: San Salvador Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Salvador“se formo con la union D. varias vecinas D. la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también hacen actividades en conjunto, con las cuales fomentan la unión D. todas.
Paola es una D. las miembros. Ella se dedica a la venta D. bebidas D. todo tipo, nos comenta que este negocio la ayudado mucho, pues gracias a el tiene los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos D. la casa y la manutención D. la familia. Uno D. sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y D. esa forma poder seguir ayudando en la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. cervezas, vinos, licores, whiskys y demás tipos D. bebidas, con las cuales podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The San Salvador communal bank was formed when several neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso came together. All of the members of the bank have their own independent businesses, but they also conduct some of their activities in common which promotes the unity of all.

Paola is one of these members. She sells all kinds of drinks and states that this business has helped her a great deal since thanks to it she has the necessary income to cover her household expenses and support her family. One of her dreams is to be ale to continue expanding her business and thus continue helping her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy beer, wine, liquor, whisky and other types of drinks so that she is able to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine, liquor and whisky for later sale

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Madame Mariama  est âgée  de 37 ans et vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 3 et 25ans. Elle s’active depuis plus de 4 ans dans le commerce et la vente de tissus teintés. C’est une activité qu’elle a hérité de sa maman et aussi qui lui procure beaucoup de passion. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle habite depuis juillet 2011 et sollicite un crédit de 150000frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus teintés destinés  à la vente. Son objectif est de renforcer son activité de commerce, augmenter ses profits et améliorer ses conditions de vie sociale.
texts.en: Mrs. Mariama is 37 years old and lives in Senegal. She is a married mother of 7 children, who are between the ages of 3 and 25. She has been selling dyed fabrics for over 4 years. It’s a business that she inherited from her mother and for which she also has a lot of passion. She has been a member of one of her local UIMCEC banks since July 2011 and is seeking a loan of 150,000 frs to buy dyed fabrics to resell. Her goal is to grow her business, increase her profits, and improve the conditions of her social life.

loans.use: to buy dyed fabrics to resell

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Afiwa est une femme âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée  å un commerçant. Elle a 2 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier à 4 ans et le dernier a 9 mois.  
Afiwa travaille comme coiffeuse depuis 2009. Elle coiffe tous clients dans son salon. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille avec deux apprentis. 
Afiwa a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits cosmétique, des mèches, des tissages et des bazins. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Afiwa voudrait agrandir son atelier. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afiwa is a 26-year-old woman. She is married to a shopkeeper. She has two children, one of whom is in school. The first-born is four and the youngest is nine months old.

Afiwa has been working as a hairdresser since 2009. She does the hair of all the clients in her salon. She buys her products in Lomé. She works with two apprentices.

Afiwa requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy beauty products, hair extensions, weaves and colorful cloths. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Afiwa would like to expand her workshop. She says that with the profits, she plans to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria, es de la ciudad de Luque, ella es una cliente recurrente de la fundación, ya que ella por medio de la ayuda que le damos ha podido ir creciendo y ampliando su mercado de ventas. La misma es casada, vive con su marido y sus cuatros hijos.
Maira se dedica a la artesanía hace mas de 10 años, fabrica sombreros y canastas artesanales y los vende por los barrios y las fiestas patronales de cada ciudad. Comenta que actualmente tiene muchos pedidos por que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y le pidieron para hacer canastas de navidad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de canastos prefabricados para que de esa forma pueda cumplir con el pedido que le habian hecho.
Dicho prestamo le dara un mejor margen de ganancia a su negocio, lo que le ayudara a mejorar su nivel de vida y la de sus hijos ya que cuenta con 4 hijos los cuales todos son estudiantes y a su vez le ayudan a su madre en dicho trabajo
texts.en:
María is from the city of Luque.  She is a recurring client of the foundation, since by means of the help we give her she has been able to grow and expand her sales market.  She is married and lives with her husband and four children.

María has been working in crafts for more than 10 years.  She makes hats and baskets by hand and sells them in the neighborhoods and at the patron saint day festivals in each city.  She comments that currently she has many orders because the holiday season is coming and she has requests for Christmas baskets.

She is requesting the loan to buy prefabricated baskets to be able to fill the orders she has received.

The loan will give her business a better profit margin, which will help her to improve the standard of living for herself and her children, since she has four children, all of whom are students and also help their mother in her work.

loans.use: to buy baskets to sell.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
La señora Emilia tiene 44 años de edad, está casada hace 17 años con el señor Ramón de 50 años de edad, el matrimonio tiene dos hijos, uno 16 y 2 años respectivamente, la mayor está cursando el 2do de la media del bachillerato técnico en informática, el menor todavía no ha empezado la escuela.
La sra. Emilia se dedica a la venta ambulante hace 1 año, como no le resultó su negocio anterior de agroveterinaria emprendió este nuevo proyecto. Comenta que su marido trabaja como empleado en un negocio de veterinaria en Ciudad del Este y juntos se ayudan a llevar adelante los gastos de la familia y asi costear el estudio de su hija ya que falta poco para empezar a estudiar una carrera universitaria. Ellos tienen como sueño que se hija sea una profesional universitaria.                                                    Solicita este préstamo para la compra de productos para su negocio como ser ollas a presión, cacerolas, jarra forrada, latonas, remeras, blusas, y otros articulos que le permitira ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y poder mejorar su ingreso mensual.-
texts.en:
Emilia, 44, has been married to Ramón, 50, for 17 years.  They have two children who are 16 and 2 years old respectively.  The oldest is in the second years of technical high school studying computer sciences and the youngest hasn’t started school yet.

Emilia has been a street vendor for a year because her previous business, a veterinary/farm supply, did not work out.  She comments that her husband works as an employee in a veterinary shop in Ciudad del Este and together they try to cover family expenses and to pay for their daughter’s studies since she’s soon to start her university career.  Their dream is that she graduates university with a profession.  She’s asking for the loan to buy products for her business like: pressure cookers, pots, thermos bottles, brass bowls, t-shirts, blouses and other items that will allow her to offer a variety to her customers and thus improve her monthly income.

loans.use: to buy a pressure cooker, pots, lined jug, t-shirts, blouses and other items.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi est un homme âgé de 29 ans. Il est célibataire sans enfant.  
kossi travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il vend de la quincaillerie pour tous clients dans une boutique. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Il n’a pas de  difficulté.
kossi a requis son 1 crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la quincaillerie. Il veut réinvestir dans l'activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kossi voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit d’assumer à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Kossi is a 29 year-old man. He is single without children.
Kossi has been working as a retailer since 2010. He sells hardware for all types of clients in a store. He buys his products in Lomé. He works alone. The business is performing well.
Kossi has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy hardware. He wants to reinvest in the business.
In the coming years, Kossi would like to grown his business. He says that with the profit, he is planning on supporting himself.

loans.use: to buy hardware.

loans.name: Yulis

texts.es: Yulis de 25 años de edad vive en Soledad con su esposo y su hijo de 3 años de edad; allí tiene una sala de belleza donde ofrece servicios de peluquería  y también tiene una miscelánea en la que vende accesorios, cosméticos productos de belleza etc. Para el montaje de su negocio, aprendió en una academia servicios de belleza, posteriormente se desempeñó como ayudante en un salón de belleza y cuando estuvo preparada, se independizó y emprendió ella misma su propia aventura de negocios,   aprovechando gradualmente  la clientela para ofrecer además de productos de belleza, otras mercancías, que sus clientes necesitaban y le pedían.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una silla, un lava cabezas para peluquería y mercancía encargada, como ropa y cosméticos, para uso de sus clientes en el final de año que se acerca con mucho dinero rotando,.
texts.en:
Yulis, 25, lives in Soledad with her husband and 3-year-old son.  She has a beauty salon there where she offers barber shop services; she also has a variety store where she sells accessories, cosmetics, beauty products, etc.  

To open the business she took courses at a beauty school and later worked as an assistant in a beauty salon.  When she felt she was prepared, she became independent and launched her own adventure in business gradually availing herself of her customers to also sell beauty products and other merchandise that they requested or needed.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy a salon chair, a hair wash sink and merchandise she has pending orders for like clothes and cosmetics for her customers’ use during the end of year when there is much money in circulation.

loans.use: to buy a salon chair, a hair wash basin and merchandise she has on order.

loans.name: Mireyda Irene

texts.es:
La señora Mireyda tiene 55 años y viven el la colonia Reyes Caballero en el municipio de San Manuel. Tiene 20 años junto a su pareja Miguel, lo cual vende mercadería. La pareja tiene dos hijas de 17 y 20 años de edad, las cuales no están estudiando. La hija mayor ya no vive con la familia. 

Hace 7 años, Mireyda empezó a vender mercadería como blusas, jeans y zapatos. Al no encontrar trabajo, se puso a vender para obtener un ingreso que le ayudaba a sostener la familia. Ella dedica tiempo completo al negocio y lo ha mantenido bien. 

Solicitó este crédito de L10,000 para surtir su inventario con la compra de ropa de dama, caballero y niño. Su plan es obtener mayores ingresos este fin de año para llegar a tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Mireyda is 55 years old and lives in the Reyes Caballero development in the town of San Manuel.  She has been with her partner Miguel for twenty years.  He sells merchandise.  Together they have two daughters aged 17 and 20, who are no longer in school.  Their elder daughter doesn't live with them any more.

Seven years ago, Mireyda began to sell merchandise such as blouses, jeans, and shoes.  As she couldn't find employment, she decided to start selling so as to earn an income to help her support her family.  She works full-time on her business, and has kept it going well.

She has requested this loan of L10,000 to stock up her inventory by purchasing clothing for women, men and children.  Her plan is to earn more income during this year-end period, to go towards having her own home.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for women, men and children.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée å un employé. Elle a 4 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 30 ans et le dernier a 21 ans.  
Afi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1985. Elle vend des céréales et du charbon pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficulté.
Afi a requis son 2ème  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales et des charbons. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait diversifier son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Afi is a 47 year old woman. She is married to an employee. She has four children, one whom studies. The oldest is 30 years old, and the youngest is 21. Afi has been working as a vendor since 1985. She sells cereals and charcoal out of her home, to all kinds of customers. She stocks up in Lome. She works by herself. At present, she has no problems with her business. Afi has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals and charcoal. She would like to reinvest in her business. In the years to come, Afi would like to diversify her business. She says that she plans to provide for some family needs with the revenues obtained.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and cereals

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Ana se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Chore. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también realizan actividades en conjunto para recaudar fondos y de esa forma tener un ahorro por si tengan algún inconveniente. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su unión.
Una de las miembros es la señora Cristina, quien es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la cría de animales, como ser de cerdo y de gallinas. Comenta que este trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya qe implica mucho esfuerzo, pues debe de cuidar a sus animales y ver que no tengan ningún problema. le va muy bien en su negocio, por lo que solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para seguir creciendo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos pequeños para la cría, como así también de alimentos para estos.
texts.en:
The “Santa Ana” committee was formed when several neighbors from the city of Chore joined together.  All the members of the committee carry out independent activities but they also do joint projects to raise funds and have savings available for any eventuality.  The members formed a very united group that’s capable of carrying out joint activities designed to strengthen their union.

One of the members is Cristina who is group President.  She raises animals like pigs and chickens.  She comments that this type of work is very demanding because it requires much effort for she has to care for her animals insuring they have no problems.  She does very well in her business so is asking the Fundación and Kiva for help to continue growing.  She’s asking for the loan to buy piglets to raise and also to buy feed for them.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and also to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima - El Tambo Group

texts.es:
La señora REDMIRA D. 55 años D. edad, es socia D. la Alcancía comunal “Virgen D. Fátima – El Tambo”, Ella es una madre casada que tiene dos hijos el hijo mayor tiene un  trabajo independiente, el hijo menor cursa en el colegio del estado. 
La socia se levanta a tempranas horas D. la mañana para que pueda atender en su bodega  venta D. productos comestibles como azúcar, arroz, patatas, bebidas, verduras, condimentos, carnes y otros. Solicito el préstamo para la compra D. productos comestibles así poder variar y surtir su bodega con mas productos. Está ubicada la quinta persona lado izquierda vestida con  polo color rojo.
texts.en: Redmira, 55, is a member of the “Virgen D. Fátima-El Tambo” communal bank.  She is married and has two children.  The oldest works independently and the youngest is going to public school.  She rises very early in the morning to open her grocery store selling foodstuffs like sugar, rice, potatoes, soft-drinks, vegetables, condiments, meats and others.  She asked for the loan to buy foodstuffs to vary her store’s stock with more items.  She is the fifth person from the left dressed in a red polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Koli

texts.fr:
Koli est une femme âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 2 enfants, qui vont  à l’école. Le premier a 12 ans et le dernier a 9 ans.  
Koli travaille comme couturière depuis 2004. Elle est couturière et vend des articles de mercerie pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment elle n’a pas de difficulté. 
Koli a requis son 3ème  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des articles de mercerie. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Koli voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit  prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koli is a 37-year-old woman. She is married to a driver, and has two children who attend school. The first is 12 years old and the last is 9.

Koli has been working as a seamstress since 2004. She is a trained seamstress and sells sewing supplies to all-comers from her home. She resupplies in Lome. She works alone, and at this time is experiencing no difficulties.

Koli requested her third WAGES credit loan to purchase sewing supplies, as she wants to reinvest in her business activity.

In coming years, Koli would like to open a shop. She said that with the profits she intends to take care of her family.

loans.use: Buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Pablo Roberto

texts.es: Pablo Roberto tiene 37 años, es un hombre responsable que tiene bajo su cargo 6 hijos de diferentes edades. El se dedica a una pequeña pulpería que tiene en su casa de habitación, inicio con esfuerzo propio ya que tenia la necesidad de tener un empleo y al mismo tiempo proveerle a su familia los ingresos del hogar. Uno de los sueños que Pablo tiene es poder realizarle mejora a su vivienda y con el paso del tiempo poder lograrlo. El solicita el crédito con el fin de comprar granos básicos, huevos, leche, fideos, aceite, jabón.
texts.en: Pablo Roberto is 37 years old.  He is a responsible man with six children of various ages in his care.  He has a small, home-based grocery store.  He started it with his own effort because he needed employment and to provide income for his family and home.  One of Pablo’s dreams is to make some home improvements and in time to do so.  He requests the loan to buy basic grains, eggs, milk, noodles, oil and soap.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Epifanía

texts.es:
La señora Epifania Ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable en cuanto a sus obligaciones con la fundación y con kiva. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por darle la oportunidad de trabajar a través de los créditos y así seguir aumentando su negocio.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de Frazadas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en: Epifania has proven to be a very responsible person regarding her commitments with the foundation and with Kiva.  She is thankful to Fundacion Paraguaya for giving her the opportunity to work with loans to grow her business.  She requests a loan to buy blankets, to help supply her business and meet her client's demands.

loans.use: to buy blankets for sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 38 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 8 years, Joy has been working hard with her husband to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap and other household goods. 

To help expand her business, Joy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar and soap for resale, and will help Joy to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Joy hopes that in the future she will be able to be helped to set up a sugar wax business. 

Joy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Rosa se dedica a la confeccion de ropa, tiene un taller de costura el cual se encuentra ubicado en su casa de habitación, Maria cuenta con clientes fijos para la confección de trajes, vestidos, blusas y otras prendas de vestir, Maria los fines de semana hace trabajos especificos para una señora que tiene otro taller de costura, Maria se encarga de darles el acabado final a las prendas, ahi le pagan por trabajo terminado,  gracias a estos ingresos ha logrado ir realizando mejoras a su vivienda, en donde vive con su mama, su hijo y sus hermanos.
Maria utilizara el credito para la compra de materiales para construccion, desea terminar un cuarto que hace meses esta haciendo en su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Señora María Rosa is a dressmaker. She has a sewing workshop in her home. María has loyal customers who order suits, dresses, blouses and other garments. In the weekends María performs specific works for the owner of another sewing workshop, where she gives the final touch to garments and is paid per finished item. Thanks to this income María could improve her home, where she lives with her mother, her son and her siblings.

María will use her loan to buy construction materials. She wants to finish a room that she has been building in her home for months.

loans.use: to buy cement, gutters, iron bars, metal sheets and blocks.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además decidida y alegre. Convive con Clever, fruto de esa unión tienen cinco hijos de 20, 16, 14, 8 y 5 años. Juntos habitan cómodamente en su casa propia, que logró comprar hace 9 años. La actividad que realiza Silvia es la venta de abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su propia casa, asimismo vende golosinas y gaseosas en la misma bodega, iniciándose con un préstamo que le dio su suegra hace 3 años. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logró mantener su negocio, ahora contando con una buena afluencia de clientes, a los que atiende muy amablemente con el apoyo de su esposo cuando no está trabajando y sus hijos cuando no están en estudios. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el contar con un ingreso económico para apoyar a su esposo ya que con el ingreso de obrero no le alcanzaba. Además del tiempo libre que tiene y el atender a sus pequeños hijos. Sin embargo, lo que no le gusta es cuando le falta capital para surtir su bodega, pero eso no la desanima, y tiene planes de hacer crecer y ampliar su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, está agradecida con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de productos para así surtir su bodega, considera que a mayor variedad de productos, tendrá mayores preferencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia, 40, is a hardworking, enterprising woman besides being determined and cheerful.  She lives with Clever and they have five children who are 20, 16, 14, 8 and 5 years old.  They live comfortably together in their own house that she managed to buy nine years ago.  

Silvia sells groceries in a home-based store; she sells snacks and soft-drinks there too.  She started out with a loan from her mother-in-law three years ago.  With much effort and dedication she managed to stay in business with help from her husband when he’s not at work and from her children when they aren’t at school.  What she likes about her activity is having a steady income to help her husband because what he earned as a laborer was insufficient in addition to being able to have free time to tend to her small children.  However, what she doesn’t like is when she lacks capital to stock her store but that does not discourage her and she has plans to make her business grow and expand.

This is loan MFP loan #2.  She’s grateful for the financial support to advance with her business and commits to making her payments like she’s done with previous loans.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy products to stock her store.  She believes that with a wider selection of products her customers will prefer her still more.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: El señor Juan , es un humilde agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , el se siente muy conteto por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondo Kiva , ya que con su primer credito logro recuperar gran parte del cultivo de piña , por la compra fertilizante e insumos que aplico en su debido tiempo. La mayor afectacion que se le presento en este ciclo fue dedibo a los precios de mercado llegando a costar menos de cincunta centavos por cada piña , lo cual no le permitio obtener muchas gancias , mas que pagar su credito en tiempo establecido y ahora no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar la inversion para la compra de fertilizante e insumos requerio para la mantencion del cultivo .
texts.en: Señor Juan is a humble farmer living in the area of Ticuantepe. He is very happy for the support given by Kiva funds through the microfinance institution Afodenic, because his first loan enabled him to recoup much of his pineapple crop thanks to the timely use of fertilizers and agricultural inputs. His biggest challenge during this loan cycle was when the market price dropped below 50 centavos for one pineapple. This did not leave him a lot of money after having paid off his loan on schedule. Now Juan doesn't have enough capital to make the necessary investments, namely buying fertilizers and agricultural inputs to keep his farming business running.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es: Myriam de 56 años es una mujer emprendedora madre de un hijo de 21 años de edad, que vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a la fabricación de productos de fritanguera, pasteles, hayacas y productos derivados de la harina de trigo, además de la venta de refrescos y también de queso.  Desde hace 30 años, su madre viajó a Venezuela, país fronterizo con Colombia, y le dejó una tienda en la que Myriam puso su primera venta de avena y pan, posteriormente cambió esta actividad por la de fabricación de fritos, actividad que ha conservado durante sus cambios de residencia y con la cual ha logrado salir adelante con su familia.  Myriam sabe hacer de todo un poco en el área de culinaria, porque también ha tenido negocio de restaurante, e ha ido bien pero cuando se tiene que mudar empieza nuevamente la venta de fritos.  En esta actividad la ayuda su hermana, distribuyen en tiendas y  a la comunidad de su barrio al detalle. Sus compras las hace de contado en pequeñas cantidades y su sueño de crecimiento, está basado en adecuar una buena infraestructura para mostrar sus productos y ofrecer un ambiente confortable a sus clientes.  Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  una vitrina,  un peso para pesar el queso, mesas y sillas para agregar almuerzos, como un nuevo producto que últimamente ha pedido su mercado, pues conocen la sazón con que en este negocio se cocina. Su sueño más adelante es tener su casa propia y sobre todo crecer como empresaria y como negociante, teniendo el capital de trabajo suficiente para mantener a su clientela como  a ella le gusta: satisfecha.
texts.en:
Myriam, 56, is an enterprising woman and mother of a 21-year-old son.  She lives in the city of Barranquilla and works making fried fast food items, cakes, ‘hayacas’ [type of tamale] and other products derived from wheat flour; she also sells soft-drinks and cheese.  

Thirty years ago her mother moved to Venezuela, a country bordering Colombia, and left Myriam a store where she started her first business selling oatmeal and bread.  She later changed this business for the one making fried fast food items, an activity she’s kept throughout her changes in residence and with which she’s managed to get ahead with her family.  

Myriam knows how to do a little of everything related to cooking because she’s also owned a restaurant.  She’s done well but every time she has to move she falls back on making fried fast food.  Her sister helps her in this activity; they sell to local stores and to her neighborhood community at retail.  She buys in small amounts and pays cash and her dream for growth is based on installing improved infrastructure to display her products and provide a comfortable environment for her customers.  

This is the reason she’s calling on Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to request her first Kiva loan to buy a display case, a scale to weigh the cheese and tables and chairs to start serving lunches as a new product her market is asking for because they know the tasty way she cooks.  Her dream for later on is to own her house and, above, all, to grow as a businesswoman and merchant having sufficient working capital to keep her customers the way she likes to: satisfied.

loans.use: to buy a display case, a scale to weight the cheese, tables and chairs to add lunches.

loans.name: Kenya Yicel

texts.es:
La señora  Kenya labora para una Drogueria en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, ahi se desempeñá como Auxiliar de Bodega, tiene 19 Meses de estar trabajando para dicha empresa, gracias a su trabajo y al apoyo que recibe de su esposo (electricista),  ha logrado ir haciéndole mejoras a su vivienda, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ventanas, puertas e instalación de piso.
con estas mejoras podra brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos pequeños niños, mismos que actualmente estudian en la Escuela Publica de la Colonia donde residen.
texts.en: Señora Kenya works as a store assistant in a drugstore in the city of Tegucigalpa. She has been working for this company for 19 months. Thanks to her job and the support from her husband, an electrician, she managed to make home improvements. She will use this loan to buy windows and doors as well as install the floor. With these improvements she can offer a better quality of life to her two small children, who currently attend the public school in their neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy windows, doors and bricks for the floor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy locks and weaves

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Jacqueline est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée à un médecin. Elle a 2 enfants.
Jacqueline travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle vend du charbon de bois pour tous clients, ambulante. Elle achète les produits à Anié. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficulté.
Jacqueline a requis son 2 crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Jacqueline voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 30-year-old woman. She is married to a doctor, and has two children.

Jacqueline has been working as a retail merchant since 2004. She sells charcoal to all-comers as an itinerant vendor. She resupplies in Anié, works alone, and at this time is experiencing no difficulties.

Jacqueline has requested her second WAGES credit loan to buy charcoal, as she wants to reinvest in her business activity.

In coming years, Jacqueline intends to increase the size of her business. She said she will use the profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: Buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Etel

texts.es: Etel, tiene la edad  de 29 años, está en unión libre y vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos que son sus mayores prioridades.  Ella con el crédito va comprar materiales de construcción con arena cemento y otro para mejorar una parte de su hogar. Ella actualmente cuenta con su hogar propio y quieren hacerle un cuarto dormitorio mas para una de sus hijas. Ella pretende darle a su familia la comodidad de un hogar en condiciones iguales para todos para un mejor bienestar familiar. Ella quiere poder terminar con la construcción del cuarto para su hija  y así generarle la privacidad que cada una de ellas requiere y comodidad para una mejor vivencia en el hogar de ellos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Etel, 29, is in a common law relationship; she lives with her husband and two children who are her greatest priorities.  She will use the loan to buy building materials like sand, cement and others to improve part of her house.  She currently owns her house and she wants to add a bedroom for one of her daughters.  She intends to provide her family with comfort in a home with equal conditions for everyone to improve family wellbeing.  She wants to finish building her daughter’s bedroom so that she can have the privacy each one of them requires to be comfortable and so that they can all live in better harmony at home.

This is the first loan she’s received from FUDECOSUR.  She’s had no previous loans with state banks and FUDECOSUR has offered her the best terms and a much lower interest rate

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 46 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 12 years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells timber and makes furniture. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber for resale, and will help Patrick to generate greater profits and pay school fees for children. Patrick hopes that in the future he will be able to buy an electrical machine for the timber. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more timber for resale

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Pablo es casado, tiene 34 años de edad, curso los 2 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos 3 de los cuales estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría y ahora quiere aperturar una tienda en general, inició la tejeduría con su señor padre y lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para compra productos para tienda: jugos, aguas gaseosas, golosinas, azúcar, productos lácteos y entre otros, espera ver su negocio grande en un próximo futuro.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Pablo, aged 34, is married and the father of four children, with three of them studying. He himself attended elementary school until second grade. He is a weaver. He started this activity with his father and has so far gained a 4-year-long experience.

Today Juan Pablo wants to open a grocery. He applies for a loan to buy products for his store: juices, sodas, candy, sugar, dairy products and others. He hopes that his business will become large in the near future.

loans.use: to buy groceries for his store.

loans.name: Damalie

texts.en:
Damalie is 38 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 7 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Damalie has been working hard to manage her clinic, which provides basic health services and sells medicine. 

To help expand her business, Damalie has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine for resale, and will help Damalie to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Damalie hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Damalie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Damalie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for resale

loans.name: Duo El Sueño Group

texts.es:
DUO EL SUEÑO
Integrada por Susana,  una joven comerciante de 25 años, ella  actualmente realiza y vende productos de bisutería, productos por catalogo como perfumería, joyería, ropa, zapatos, también  vende producto medicinal mas conocido como ONMILIFE siendo ella la lider del duo nos esta solicitando este credito para la compra de calzado ropa y joyeria, Don Carlos, tiene en su domicilio una pequeña venta de consumo diario, don Carlos quiere invertir un poco mas en su pequeño negocio, ya que en ocasiones ha tenido que quedar mal con sus vecinos que visitan su negocio y el nos cuenta con el producto que ellos buscan o necesitan.
Ambos tienen deseos de superar  y ver crecer  sus negocios donde diariamente les provee el sustento diario y  el apoyo para sus familias, esperando puedan tener el apoyo en préstamo de capital y ellos invertirlo de la mejor manera posible.
texts.en:
One of the members of Duo El Sueño Group (the dream) is Susana, a young merchant of 25. Currently she makes and sells costume jewelry; she sells products by catalog such as perfumes, jewelry, clothing and shoes; she also sells medical products from the well-known Omnilife product line. Susana is the leader of this dual group. She applies for this loan to buy clothing, footwear and jewelry.

The other member is Don Carlos. He runs a small grocery at home. He wants to increase somewhat his inventory, because at times he was embarrassed when his neighbors came to his store and he didn't have the product they wanted or needed.

Both group members desire to succeed and see their business grow which provide for their daily needs and support their families. They hope that they will get the required financial support and will invest it in the best possible manner.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, clothes and footwear.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 11 years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy new spare parts for resale, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rebecca who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy new spare parts for resale

loans.name: Francisco Anselmo

texts.es: Don Francisco es humilde agricultor de la zona de San Ignacio , desde hace varios , la mayor afectación que se le presento en este año fueron las lluvias , ya que donde estaba ubicado el cultivo pasaron enormes corrientes de agua , lo cual se llevo la producción pero por gracias de dios cuenta con el apoyo de su hija y juntos están tratando de salir adelante resembrando los pocos hijos de piña que quedaron , pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para una buena cosecha , lo cual solicita de apoyo económicos atraves de Afodenic hacia los fondo Kiva , para comprar exfoliantes , fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para la producción .
texts.en:
Don Francisco is a humble farmer from the area of San Ignacio. 

For many, the highest area of difficult concerns that presented itself this year was the rain, because of where it was located. The crops became huge running streams of water, which carried away the harvest but thanks to God, with the help of his daughter, together they are trying to get ahead by replanting offshoots of the pineapples left behind. 

But they do not have enough capital to buy the fertilizer and supplies necessary for a good crop, and this is why they are asking for financial support from Afodenic through Kiva funding, in order to buy exfoliants, fertilizers and supplies needed for farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Duo Flor De Cafe Group

texts.es:
DUO  FLOR DE CAFÉ
Doña Simona, es una persona trabajadora que día a día se dedica al comercio porque es el único medio que tiene para poder salir adelante,siendo ella la lider del grupo, vende en el mercado municipal de la localidad verduras, frutas y otros productos para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su familia tienen bajo su responsabilidad a dos niños menores de edad que necesitan el cuidad de sus padres, ella solo quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos y para que  puedan tener una vida mejor por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra de frutas y verduras, para poder  surtir mas su negocio y tener mas ganancias. Jesus,  ella se dedica a la venta  de verduras, frutas y artículos de consumo diario  en el mercado municipal desde hace unos años, también en las tardes vende en la plaza municipal  pollos y papas  fritos  ha podido salir adelante ella y su familia gracias a su negocio, ella necesita un capital para poder engrandar mas su negocio porque todavía no cuenta con todo lo necesario, y para poder obtener un poco mas de ganancia
texts.en:
DUO  FLOR DE CAFÉ

Simona is a hardworking person who works as a merchant day to day because it is the only way she has to get ahead. She is the leader of the group, and she sells vegetables, fruit and other products in the local market. She does this to help her husband with the family expenses. She is raising two young children who need their parents' care. She only wants to get her children ahead so that they can have a better life. That is why she is asking for this loan  to buy fruit and vegetables to stock her business more and make more income. She has sold fruit and vegetables and items of daily consumption in the city market for several years. She also sells chicken and french fries in the city plaza to get her and her family ahead, thanks to her business. She needs the capital to grow her business more because she still doesn't have everything she needs to make a little more income.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Irma Florinda

texts.es:
La señora Irma Florinda es soltera, tiene 21 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación media, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa típica para mujeres, inició este negocio con el apoyo de su mamá, y hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo como capital para comprar mercadería, consistente en cortes, delantales, güipiles, blusas, fajas, sabanas. Espera ver grande su negocio en el futuro.
texts.en:
Irma Florinda is single. She is 21 years old and finished three years of middle school. She sells traditional women's clothing. She started this business with her mother's help, and she has 4 years' experience.   

She is asking for a loan to invest it as capital to buy merchandise. This will consist of aprons, huipiles, blouses, sashes, and sheets. She hopes to see her business get big in the future.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing for resale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 14 years, Hawa has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hairdressing for local women. 

To help expand her business, Hawa has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase the equipment needed to do special braids, and will help Hawa to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Hawa hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Hawa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hawa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase the equipment needed to do special braids.

loans.name: Oscar Vicente

texts.es: El señor Oscar  , es un humilde agricultor de la zona de Nindirí , junto a su esposa la cual labora como comerciante para apoyarle con los gatos del hogar , ya que tienen hijos a su cargo , los planes hacia du familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que su mayor ilusión es que sus hijos lleguen a la universidad , don Oscar desde hace varios años se dedica a los cultivos de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivos ya que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para una mejor producción .Agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atraves de los fondos Kiva ; ya que son muchos los agricultores que se benefician con estos programas de apoyo a la personas del campo .
texts.en: Oscar is a humble farmer in the Nindirí area of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife, who works as a merchant to help with household expenses, and they have children under their care. Their plan is to improve their living conditions because their biggest dream is for their children to attend college. Oscar has cultivated pineapple for a number of years. The biggest problem he faces is when pests invade his crops, since he lacks fertilizer and necessary ingredients for better production. He is grateful for the support Afodenic provides through the Kiva loans since there are many farmers who benefit from these programs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Jesus Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Jesus Margarita es soltera, tiene 41 años de edad, cursó el primer año de educación media, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, inició este negocio como operaria y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y clases, y crear mas productos, espera ver en el futuro su negocio grande y con amplio capital
texts.en: Jesus Margarita is 41 years old, single and completed one year of middle school. She makes a living weaving typical styles. She started the business as a machine operator and has 10 years of experience. She is requesting the loan to purchase yarns of different colors and styles to create more products. She hopes in the future to see her business grow and to expand her capital.

loans.use: to purchase yarn.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past two years, Fred has been working hard to manage his small shop, which buys old metal materials to recycle and sell. 

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more metal scrap for resale, and will help Fred to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Fred hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

Fred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Fred, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more metal scrap for resale.

loans.name: Duo Las Margaritas 3 Group

texts.es:
duo las margaritas 3
doña maría transita Martínez mas conocida como doña concha por todos clientes es la lider del duo, ella sale 3 veces por semana a comprar sus verduras y frutas y tambien mercaderia para tienda en la terminal de Guatemala para servir a sus clientes buen producto, ella compartió con nosotros que esta oportunidad que fape le brinda es para un apoyo ya que con ello, ella logra invertir y que lo mas importante es que en la zona donde ella vende esta sola ella y que eso le ayuda bastante porque no tiene competencia y necesita su segundo crédito para seguir invirtiendo en compera de frutas y verduras y crecer en su negocio, de la misma forma doña Zoila comenzó su negocio desde ya unos años con dinero propio,  pero ase el comentario que el mismo negocio le ha pedido crecer mas y por eso necesita capital para invertir, dice que apezar que en le sector donde ella vive hay un poco de competencia sus clientes siempre la buscan en su tienda y su anhelo es que fape siempre la apoye.
texts.en: María, better known as Doña Concha by all of her customers, is the leader of this duo. She goes out three times a week to purchase fruits and vegetables as well as other products so she can provide her customers with good products at her store in the bus station. She shared with us that she is turning to Kiva partner FAPE for support because with it she will be able to continue to invest in her business. She added that most importantly she is the only person selling in her area and this helps her quite a bit because she doesn't have competition. She needs the loan to continue investing in the purchase of fruits and vegetables to grow her business. In the same way, Zoila started her business some years ago with her own money, but said that in order to grow it more she needs more capital to invest. She added that in the area where she lives there is little competition, so her customers always seek out her store. Her goal is that FAPE always supports her.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables and other supplies.

loans.name: Alejandro José

texts.es: El señor Alejandro es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa e hijos, su esposa labora como comerciante de nacatamales , para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ya que tienen hijos a su cargo , don Alejandro desde hace varios años trabaja en un empresa privada , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su sueldo no es suficiente para poder realizar de una sola vez la reconstrucción de su humilde vivienda ,ya que necesita bloques , cemento , arena , piedrín , hierro , zinc , etc. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atraves de los fondos Kiva ya que con la ayuda que brinda son muchos las familias de escasos recursos que logran cambiar sus vidas obteniendo un techo digno .
texts.en: Alejandro lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife and children.  His wife sells nacatamales to help with the household expenses since they have children to take care of.  For several years Alejandro has worked for a private business.  The biggest problem he faces is that his salary doesn't provide him with enough to rebuild his modest home all at once, since he needs cinder blocks, cement, sand, gravel, iron, zinc, etc.  He is thankful for the support he has received from Afodenic through Kiva's funding as their help allows many families with limited resources to change their lives by putting a decent roof over their heads.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es: El señor Lelis es cliente antiguo de la institución desde el año 2007, el es carpintero, casado su familia la integra  cuatro hijos, tres en edad escolar y un niño de cuatro años, el señor Lelis y su esposa trabajan como carpinteros desde mas  de 25 años, es excelente en el trabajo que realiza, elaboran todo tipo de muebles, sus dos hijos mayores y su esposa le ayudan en todo el trabajo y su hijo mayor de 18 años ya elabora muebles. Ellos tienen un taller en la casa de su suegra ubicada en la zona Nuevo Amanecer y ellos vive en la Cota Cota  en la casa de sus parientes donde construyo su departamento, el en este momento tiene un trabajo para en acabado fino de muebles, donde necesita material para tal trabajo como ser la compra de madera, barniz, laca mate, gasolina, etc. razón por que solicita el crédito.
texts.en: Lelis has been a longstanding client of the institution since 2007.  He’s a carpenter.  He’s married and his family is composed of four children, three of them are school aged and one is a four-year-old.  Lelis and his wife have worked as carpenters for over 25 years.  He is excellent in the work he does.  They make all kinds of furniture.  His two oldest children and his wife help him in all the work and his 18-year-old son is already manufacturing furniture.  They have a workshop located at his mother-in-law’s house located in the Nuevo Amanecer zone; they live in Cota Cota in a family member’s house where he built his apartment.  At the moment, he has a job that needs its final fine finishing touches.  He needs materials for this job such as lumber, varnish, matte lacquer, gasoline, etc. and this is the reason for the loan request.

loans.use: to buy lumber, varnish, matte lacquer, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en la ciudad de Caaguazú, son 24 mujeres quienes se agruparon para formar un comité solidario, las mismas son señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, poseen un espíritu emprendedor y de ayuda mutua. Ellas asumieron el compromiso de no fracasar y sobresalir trabajando en equipo con el Apoyo que le ofrece la Fundación Paraguaya, actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras.
Una de las miembros es la señora Lariza, quien se dedica a la costura. Por medio de este trabajo ella puede mantener a su familia y obtener los medios necesarios para cubrir los gastos diarios. Ella comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio por lo que quiere seguir creciendo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, cierres, botones, gomas y demás insumos para abastecer su taller.
texts.en:
