texts.es: Hortencia, tiene 50 años D. edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos todos ya son mayores D. edad,su negocio lo inicio hace 5 años el cual lo nombro Micelanea Divino Salvador,con el credito anterior que kiva le brindo pudo adicionar a sus ventas productos comestibles D. primera nececidad,es por eso que esta solicitando este credito,ya que ella quiere invertir en calzado D. todos los estilos para dama y caballeros,ya que se hacercan fechas festivas y es cuando sus cliente buscan calzado, ella dice que es una oportunidad muy bonita para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: Hortencia is 50, married and has 3 children who are all adults.  She started a business 5 years ago called "Micelanea Divino Salvador", and with a prior loan bought an inventory of food items.  She now seeks to buy a stock of various styles of men's and women's shoes, which are popular during local festivals and holidays.  She hopes this will be an excellent opportunity and will allow her to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's shoes

loans.name: Mauro Antonio

texts.es:
Mauro tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia, con esposa e hijos en una Comunidad ubicada a 30 minutos del distrito de Tambogrande perteneciente a Las Lomas; que corresponden a la Región Piura, ubicado a 4 horas  del departamento de Lambayeque. Esta comunidad se caracteriza por sus deseos  de superación. 

La actividad que desarrolla Mauro junto con su esposa, es la venta de chicha, cerveza, piqueos, en su propio domicilio, donde atiende los días viernes, sábados y domingos para lo cual ya tiene clientela establecida de la zona y aledaños. Además trabaja en parcelas cerca a su vivienda.  Su conviviente lo apoya en todas sus actividades que realiza, existiendo buena relación familiar para seguir creciendo en su negocio. Los ingresos que perciben lo utilizan para solventar los gastos familiares.

Mauro desea comprar insumos para la preparación de sus comidas y compra de más cerveza, esto con la finalidad de hacer crecer a su negocio.  Es por ello que para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1,000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa. 

Mauro cuenta con grandes deseos de superación y crecimiento en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mauro is 42, has a partner and three children.  He lives in a house he owns with his wife and children in a community located 30 minutes from the district of Tambogrande which belongs to Las Lomas, region of Piura located four hours from the department of Lambayeque.  This community is characterized for it's dreams to get ahead.

Mauro's business activity which he does together with his wife out of their home, is the sale of beer, chicha (an alcoholic drink made with corn flour and pineapple juice) and snacks, they are open Friday to Sunday and they have an established client base from their zone and surrounding areas.  He also works in a stable close to his house.  His wife supports him in the activities he does and they have a good family relationship that allows them to keep growing their business.  The income they earn is used to cover their family expenses.

Mauro wants to buy ingredients to make snacks and to buy more beer and this way grow the business.  To achieve this goal they request a loan of 1,000 new soles through Edpyme Alternativa.

Mauro has great dreams of getting ahead and growing the business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks and to buy beer for sale.

loans.name: Alfonso Esteban

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso Esteban es casado, tiene 50 años de edad, estudió la educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos 2 de los cuales estudian, se dedica ala tejeduría, inició este trabajo como operario y lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al tricotado de hilo.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilos de diferente clases y colores, y producir mas tejido, espera en el futuro ver un negocio rentable.
texts.en: Alfonso Esteban is 50, married and studied up to primary school.  He has 5 children, of whom 2 are students.  He has a weaving business which he has run for the past 8 years.  His wife assists him to knit the fiber into cloth items.  He now seeks a loan to buy thread and fiber of varied colors and kinds to increase his production of woven items, in order to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy thread and fiber for weaving cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour and sugar to bake bread

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: La socia Fortunata; continua con su negocio D. atencion D. su tienda D. abarrotes y D. la compra y venta D. lechón en el mercado mayor D. su barrio, a la socia la contartan para bautizos, matrimonios, bodas D. plata, D. oro, D. papel y otros eventos sociales y ella prepara el lechón con tamal acompañados y venD. a los clientes, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir su credito en la compra D. chanchos ya que en la ciudad las costumbres son D. comer cerdo el primero D. enero para que todo el año se tenga abundancia. La socia desea el credito para invertir en la compra D. chanchos para año nuevo.
texts.en:
The member, Fortunata, continues with her grocery store business and her business buying and selling pork in the major market of her neighborhood.  She is hired for baptisms; weddings; first, silver, and golden anniversaries; and other social events.  She prepares pork with tamales and sells it to the customers.

Now she wants to invest her loan in buying pigs, since in the city the tradition is to eat pork on January first to have abundance throughout the year.  She wants the loan to invest in buying pigs for New Year.

loans.use: to buy pigs for the new year holiday.

loans.name: Arianne

texts.en:
Arianne and Joshua have started an afternoon tutoring program and educational resource center called HYPE -- "Helping Young People Excel" -- in a shopping center in New Orleans East within a two-mile radius of five public elementary schools and two public high schools.  Arianne and Joshua have a combined experience of working with children of all ages for 16 years, Arianne as a credentialed sixth grade math and science teacher and Joshua as the organist and mentor for young congregants at their church.  

This past summer 2011 they ran a successful summer school program and helped 25 kids, some of whose reading levels jumped several grades.  Starting in January 2012, Arianne will be home-schooling several children during the school day at HYPE's facility.  HYPE will distinguish itself from other tutoring services by offering a personalized approach geared to each individual student and his or her learning abilities. 

Joshua and Arianne will use their Kiva loan to purchase a road side sign, a facade sign for HYPE's store front, plus office equipment and marketing materials.  Arianne and Joshua have no children of their own, but over the years they have nurtured the minds of hundreds of children.

loans.use: to purchase a roadside sign, a facade sign, a copier, a shredder, a laminating machine and marketing materials.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María nació en la ciudad de Urubamba pero actualmente ella vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella tiene 55 años de edad y es madre y padre para sus dos hijos.  
 
Ana María desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella se dedica a la agricultura, elaboración de artesanía y  a brindar servicio de hospedaje, ella tiene una tienda de venta de artesanía en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Ana María requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo tejidos, cerámica y otras cosas más.  

Ana María se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Ana María pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Choquekillca” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en: Ana Maria was born in the town of Urubamba but now lives in the town of Ollantaytambo; she is 55 years old and a single mother to two sons.  Ana Maria develops her daily activities and economics in the city of Ollantaytambo.  She is devoted to agriculture, the development of crafts, and providing hosting service.  She has a craft shop selling in one of the most popular markets in the city. She has been selling in this business for several years and doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  Ana Maria requires the loan to buy goods such as textiles, ceramics and other things.  Ana Maria is grateful for the opportunity afforded by this means and likewise agrees to comply with the payment schedule. Ana Maria belongs to the village bank "Lord of Choquekillca" Arariwa Association of the City of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as textiles, ceramics and other things.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es: La socia continua con su restaurante tipico, ella prepara diversos potajes tipicos de la zona, la socia estuvo siempre trabajando y ampliando su local, ella ahora forma parte de este grupo junto a sus parientes a los cuales a invitado para que formen parte de este banco y sea mas dinamico, la socia en esta ocasión desea continuar con el negocio que le va muy bien y desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de ingredientes tales como arroz al por mayor, aceite en bidones y otros productos al por mayor para que le salga a cuenta, la socia también invertira parte del prestamo en la compra de platos y cubiertos para aumentar. La socia desea seguir prosperando y seguir ampliando su negocio. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes, productos para la elaboracion de sus diferentes potajes tipicos al por mayor.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to run her traditional restaurant. She prepares diverse stews and soups that are typical of the region. Since her last loan, she has always been working and expanding her restaurant.

She is now a member of a group, along with relatives who she invited to form a communal bank. It is more dynamic.

At this time, she would like to continue with her business, which is going very well, and she would like to invest this loan in the purchase of ingredients like rice (wholesale), drums of oil, and other wholesale products so that she has them on hand. This borrower will also invest part of her loan in the purchase of dishes and covers so that she can grow. She hopes to continue prospering and to keep expanding her business. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients and other products so that she can prepare her traditional stews in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making stews

loans.name: Zainab C

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Zainab. She is married and has five children, aged 2, 4, 7, 11 and 24 years. She has two additional dependents who live with her because they are her relatives and she assists them with their schooling.  

In 2009, Zainab established her patient drugs business. She began her business with her husband who is a pharmacist, and she later established her own business. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,600,000 Sierra Leone Leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Zainab has already received and successfully repaid a loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional pharmaceutical drugs for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Zainab plans to expand the store to the level of a drugstore and to support her children's education to the university level. She cares for the sick, mainly women and children and the entire community where she lives. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for pharmaceutical drugs.

loans.name: Felipa Manuela

texts.es:
La señora Felipa Manuela es casada, tiene 53 años de edad, estudio la educación primaria, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian, se dedica a costuras delantales y cortes típicos, aprendió este oficio siendo operaria, hasta ahora lleva 30 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas típicas e hilos de diferente colores y clases, como también la compra de adornos para los delantales que ella costura. espera en el futuro  contar con mas capital.
texts.en: Felipa Manuela is married, 53 and studied up to primary school.  She has 8 children, 2 of whom are students.  She sews aprons and typical garments, operating a sewing machine, and has 30 years of experience.  Her husband helps her economically.  She seeks this loan to buy cloth and thread of different types and colors, as well as adornments for the aprons that she sews.  She hopes to grow her business capital in the future.

loans.use: to buy thread for sewing

loans.name: Santa Gema (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Santa Gema se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín (Portoviejo), este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y del Ecuador.

Este es un grupo de 12 socias y 2 socios que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos pueden mejorar sus pequeños negocios que tienen o empezar en el mundo del comercio. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

En este lugar vive la señora Georgina, tiene 49 años, está separada pero de esa relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos mayores de edad y el menor de 16 años que  estudia en colegio, tres de ellos aun vive con ella. 

Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para que ha sus hijos no les falte nada se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, tres días a la semana instala un pequeño local en el mercado de la localidad, allí en ciertas ocasiones con ayuda de sus hijos se dedica a vender estos productos los mismos que compra en el mismo mercado a mayoristas que entregan en la madrugada. Lleva más de 15 años con este negocio y esto le ha servido para salir adelante  con sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Este es su primer ciclo en el  Banco Comunal y espera seguir por mucho tiempo más.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The Santa Gema community bank meets every 15 days in Junín (Portoviejo). This place is known for its friendly and hard-working people and because the best brandy of the province and of Ecuador is distilled in this place.

This is a group of 12 female members and two male members who decided to unite and form this community bank that has served them a lot since, with the loans, they have been able to improve their small business or start in the world of commerce. They are dedicated to diverse activities such as commerce, services, selling food, among other activities.

Georgina, 49, lives in this place. She is separated, but from that relationship she had four children. Three of them are adults and the  youngest,16, studies in high school. Three of them still live with her.

She is a very good mother and housewife who, so her children do not lack anything, is dedicated to selling fruits and vegetables. Three days a week, she installs a small shop in the market in the area. There, on certain occasions, with the help of her children, she is dedicated to selling the same products that she buys from the same market at wholesale in the morning. She has more than 15 years with this business and this has helped her get ahead with her children.

This loan is to buy fruit and vegetables. This is her first cycle with the community bank and she hopes to continue for much more time.

Her dream is to have a grocery shop .

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: San Martin De Porres  - El Tambo Group

texts.es: El Señor  LUCIO FLAVIO D. 47 años D. edad, Socio D. la Alcancía comunal “San Martin D. Porras – El Tambo” casado con 3 hijo menor D. edad cursa en el colegio del estado. Se dedica a  los servicios D. imprenta  como elaboración D. libros, recibos, afiches, revistas y otros. El Préstamo solicito para la compra D. materiales como hojas D. imprenta y tintes D. colores para la elaboración D. revistas. El socio está ubicada cuarta persona lado izquierdo vestido con chompa color plomo y pantalón color negro.
texts.en: Lucio Flavo is 47 years old and a member of the “San Martin D. Porras – El Tambo” communal bank.  He’s married and has three minor children who attend the state school.  He’s a printer who prints books, receipts, posters, magazines, and other things.  He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as printing paper and inks for printing magazines.  He is the fourth person from the left in the picture, wearing a grey sweater and black pants.

loans.use: to buy printing supplies.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La socia verónica actualmente continua con su negocio y ahora mas que nunca desea invertir en su pequeña tienda en la cual vende todo tipo de golosinas, chocolates, bebidas frias y helados; la socia a trabajado mucho con su pequeño negocio y logro ampliar mas y aumentar productos ahora ella tiene mas clientes y requiere mayor prestamo para implementar us tienda en estas fiestas necesitara aumentar mercadería y continuar con su crecimiento economico. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos como, galletas, chocolates, helados, papas fritas, bocadillos, gaseosas, jugos, panetones, entre otros.
texts.en:
The member, Verónica, currently continues with her business, and now more than ever she wants to invest in her little store where she sells all types of sweets, chocolate, cold drinks, and ice cream.  She has worked a lot with her little business and managed to expand more and increase her products.

Now she has more customers and requires a major loan to set up her store.  In these holidays she will need to increase her merchandise and continue with her financial growth.

She is requesting the loan to buy cookies, chocolate, ice cream, fried potatoes, snacks, sodas, juice, "panetones" [Christmas cakes], and other products.

loans.use: to buy cookies, chocolate, ice cream, fried potatoes, snacks, sodas, juice, panettone, and other products.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila nació en la ciudad de Urubamba pero actualmente ella vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella tiene 74 años y es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora. 

Petronila desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles en su pequeña tienda que está ubicado en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Petronila requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, aceite y otras cosas más. 

Petronila se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Petronila pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Choquekillca” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Petronila was born in Urubamba but currently lives in Ollantaytambo.  She’s 74 years old and is a hardworking enterprising woman.

Petronila works in Ollantaytambo, selling food from her small store, located in her home.  She’s been doing this for several years and things are going well for her, thanks to the effort she puts forth in her work.

He needs this loan in order to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar, cooking oil, and other things.

Petronila is grateful for the opportunity given her through this medium and she promises to make her payments on time.  She’s a member of the Señor de Choquekillca” communal bank of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Alberta tiene  44 años, es casada y vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Asentamiento Humano José Carlos Mariátegui en el Distrito de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la Región Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque. 
Se dedica desde hace 25 años a la preparación y venta de comidas y bebidas.  Ella prepara estos productos en su vivienda y luego los vende en su puesto de venta de comida en su localidad.  Con los ingresos que ambos perciben se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.
Alberta desea adquirir más insumos para ampliar su producción y percibir un mayor número de ganancias. Asimismo desea adquirir más materiales para ampliar su negocio de venta. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
Alberta es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ver a su familia progresar y disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien amable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Alberta is 44 years old, married, and lives in a home of her own located in the José Carlos Mariátegui settlement in the Tambogrande district of the Piura region, four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque.

For the past 25 years she’s been preparing and selling food and drinks.  She makes these things in her home and then sells them from a local food stall.  She moves her family ahead with the income.

Alberta would like to acquire supplies in order to expand production and increase her profits.  In this way she also wants to acquire M. supplies to expand her business.  In order to meet her objective, she’s seen fit to request a loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa.

Alberta is a very responsible woman, dedicated to her family.  Her greatest desire is to see her family progress and enjoy a better quality of life.  Those who know her consider her to be very friendly and trustworthy.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and merchandise.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Sarah. She is married and has three children, aged 2, 6 and 10 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to assist her with the business.  

In 2005, Sarah established her cooking condiment business. Before establishing her own she was selling for her elder sister and in the process gained a lot of business experience and skills. This business is special to Sarah as it is an additional source of income which is used to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. 

Sarah’s customers are mainly women who daily buy cooking condiments. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Sarah has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more rice, onion, vegetable oil, salt and maggi for her business. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Sarah plans to improve the business to a store. She hopes to see her business grow to a level of making more profit, to take care of her children's education. It serves the general public. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for cooking condiments such as rice, onion, vegetable oil, salt and maggi for her business.

loans.name: Marisol July

texts.es: La socia Marisol continua con su negocio y le ha ido muy bien, ella en esta ocasión desea el credito para invertir en la compra de cerveza y chanchos para prepararlos y como tiene su stand ella vende el riquisimo plato a base de chancho llamado  "chicharron"; la socia tiene mayor numero de clientes motivo por el cual ahora desea comprar cerdos para poder criarlos y venderlos poco a poco o prepararlos y venderlos como platos, la socia desea comprar 4 cerdos para la cena de año nuevo también son muy solicitados, ya que el cerdo en la noche de año nuevo y el primero de cada año se tiene la creencia de que simbolizara la abundancia en el hogar. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de cerdos  para criarlos algunos preparalos y otros en año nuevo.
texts.en: Marisol continues with her business and it has gone very well for her. At this time, she is requesting a loan to invest by purchasing beer and pigs to butcher, since she has her food stand and sells a delicious pork-based dish called “chicharrón.” Since she has a greater number of customers, she wishes to purchase pigs to be able to raise them and sell them little by little, or butcher them and sell them plate by plate. She wishes to purchase four pigs for New Year’s Eve dinner, which is a time when pork is often requested, since it is believed that having pork for New Year’s Eve and New Year’s Day meals every year symbolizes abundance in the home. Marisol is requesting the loan to invest by purchasing pigs to raise some of them and butcher others for New Year’s celebrations.

loans.use: to invest by purchasing pigs to raise some of them and butcher others for New Year’s celebrations.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Mark. He is married, and has four children aged two, five, eight, and twelve. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to help one of his brothers send his children to school. In 1996, Mark established his used clothing business. He began his business by helping his late brother and now owns his own business. Mark sells different types of men’s trousers and shirts. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of SLL 4,500,000. Mark has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now needs a new loan to buy bales of used trousers for SLL 1,600,000, used shirts for SLL 1,100,000, and coats for SLL 1,500,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. In the future, Mark plans to open another used clothing stall that his brother, who has come from the village, will operate, and to make sure his children are well cared for. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for bales of used men's trousers.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yenny; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella tiene una tienda donde vende chompas, tejidos y también productos en cuero como sombreros y billeteras, la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante en su negocio, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como cueros, hilos y lanas para hacer los trabajos de artesanía al por mayor. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yenny is a member of the “Los Diamantes” communal bank, located in the Cusco district, province, and department.  Yenny is 26 years old, married, and sells arts and crafts.  She has a shop where she sells sweaters, woven items, and leather goods like hats, and wallets.

She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm and is getting ahead in life through this business.  She wants to expand the business and is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies such as leather, thread, and yarn to be able to make projects in large quantity.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Soledad; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de tejidos de chompas, chalinas y chalecos y también se dedica al trabajo como docente del nivel inicial en la ciudad de Cusco, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lanas y tejedores al por mayor al por mayor. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Soledad is a member of the “Los Diamantes” communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She’s 52 years old, single, and has two children.  She sells knitted sweaters, scarves, and vests.  She also works as a preschool teacher in Cusco and moves her children ahead in life through her business.

She would like to expand her clothing business and will use the money from this loan to buy yarn and knitting supplies in quantity.

She is grateful for this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy yarn and knitting supplies.

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.es: El socio Giovanni;  el socio a incursionado en la artesanía, el junto a su conyugue han puesto un stand en el centro de la ciudad junto a su hermana y han invertido parte de sus ahorros en la compra de mercaderia y ahora le esta yendo muy bien, es por esta razon que el socio desea invertir el prestanmo en la compra de artesania, el socio desea comprar tejidos, ceramios, adornos, mantas. El socio sin dejar su anterior trabajo esta comprartiendo este nuevo proyecto en su vida, el socio desea crecer y ampliar su negocio segun las ventas. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de tejidos para la venta en su stand.
texts.en: Giovanni has started to learn about handicrafts. Together with his spouse and his sister, he has set up a stand in the center of the city. He has invested some of his savings by purchasing goods, and now everything is going very well for him. For this reason, he wishes to invest the loan by purchasing handicrafts such as fabric, ceramics, ornaments, and blankets. Without sacrificing his previous work, Giovanni is sharing this new project in his life. He wishes to grow and increase his business depending on his sales. He is requesting the loan to invest by purchasing fabric to sell at his stand.

loans.use: to invest by purchasing fabric to sell at his stand.

loans.name: Vania

texts.es: La socia Vania; continua con su negocio propio en artesanía, la socia elabora bellas muñecas de trapos con mantas tejidas, y ella también vende, espejos, y mantas tejidas con lana de alpaca, lana de oveja y lanas sinteticas; la socia también vende gorritos de lana, tejidos a mano, la socia aprende todo el arte y le esta yendo muy bien, la socia tiene un stand en el centro de la ciudad, la socia en esta ocasión y como su negocio es nuevo esta implementando siempre el local y los productos de arte. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de telares, de muñecas de trapo, de adornos tipicos, de llaveros y otros para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: Vania continues with her own handicraft business. She makes beautiful rag dolls with woven blankets, and also sells mirrors and woven blankets made with alpaca, sheep, and synthetic wool. Additionally, she sells hand-knitted wool hats. She is learning about all aspects of handicrafts and things are going well for her. She has a stand in the center of the city. At this time, and because her business is new, Vania is always helping out at the stand and with her hand-crafted products. She is requesting the loan to invest by purchasing a loom, rag dolls, typical ornaments, key rings, and other items to increase her sales.

loans.use: to invest by purchasing a loom, rag dolls, typical ornaments, key rings, and other items to increase her sales.

loans.name: Minkailu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Minkailu. He is married and has three children, aged 8, 4 and 12 years. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to assist his wife with the house chores.  

In 2006, Minkailu established his provisions, soft drinks, cigarette and batteries business. He began his business because he wanted to be independent and he gained experience from his brother. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,300,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Minkailu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more provisions, drinks and batteries. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Minkailu plans to improve the business, buy a piece of land and support his children’s university education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for provisions, soft drinks and batteries for his business

loans.name: Teresita De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Teresita de Jesús y su esposo tiene un negocio de renta de equipo de sonido, solicitan el préstamo para la comprar de un equipo más moderno y con mayor capacidad de sonido. Y así aprovechar las oportunidades de que los contraten para un evento más grande. 
Aparte del ingreso que obtiene del negocio, Doña Teresita trabaja de ejecutiva de ventas y su esposo trabaja en una agencia aduanal. Tiene como objetivo llegara a tener un negocio rentable a eventos grandes y así lograr más ingresos para la familia, ya tiene dos hija que pequeña edad y a quienes les quieren dar lo mejor.
texts.en:
Teresita de Jesús and her husband have a sound equipment rental business.  They are asking for this loan to buy more up to date equipment with better sound.  In this way they will be able to take advantage of the opportunity for providing services for a larger event.

Aside from the income from this business, Teresita works as a salesperson and her husband works for the customs office.  Her goal is to create a profitable business for large events and increase the income for the family.  She has two young daughters to whom she wants to give the best.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment.

loans.name: Unión Y Fuerza (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión Y Fuerza se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín (Portoviejo), este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y del Ecuador.

Este es un grupo de 11 socias y 2 socios que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios que tienen. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

En este lugar vive la señora Celita, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos dos de ellos mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 10 años, el último es un niño especial, tres de ellos estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela y todos vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto  su esposo tiene un restaurante en el centro de la ciudad en el cual todos los días preparan deliciosos platos para los desayunos y almuerzos, trabajan todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 15h00, su restaurante es muy concurrido ya que día a día llegan muchas personas a servirse sus deliciosos platos sobretodo el viche de pescado y el pescado apanado que es lo que más prefieren sus clientes, llevan en este negocio por más de 10 años y siempre les ha ido bien.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar una mesa, 8 sillas y víveres para preparar los alimentos, este es su segundo ciclo y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es gozar de salud para seguir adelante.

En la fotografía podemos apreciar una foto pequeña adjunta que es de uno de los socios que por motivcos laborales no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto grupal. Tambien está en la foto una chica son una camiseta celeste con un niño en brazos, los dos son hijos de una socia que quisieron salir en la foto.
texts.en:
The members of the “Unión Y Fuerza” communal bank meet every two weeks in the Junín (Portoviejo) settlement.  This area is known for its friendly, hardworking people, but also because the best brandy in the province and in Ecuador is distilled here.

This group is made up of 11 women and 2 gentlemen who decided to come together to form this communal bank, whose loans have helped them very much.  They have also been able to improve their small businesses, food sales and other activities.

Here, 50 year old Celita is married and has four children, two of them adults and the others ages 16 and 10.  The youngest is a special child and the other three study at university, high school, and elementary school.  All live with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband have a restaurant in the city center, where they work every day from 5:00 am to 3:00 pm, preparing delicious dishes for breakfast and lunch.  Their restaurant is very well known and many people visit each day to partake in their delicious dishes, above all the fish stew and fried breaded fish.  This is what their customers like.  They’ve been in this business for more than 10 years and it has always done well.

They will use the money from this loan to buy a table, eight chairs, and ingredients to prepare the food.  This will be their second loan cycle and [Celita] appreciates the help she gets in getting ahead.

Her dream is to be healthy and continue moving ahead.

The photograph also includes a small photograph of one of the group’s members who was not able to be present at the group photograph because of work commitments.  It also shows a woman wearing a light blue top and a child in her arms.  Both of the children are hers and they wanted to be in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a table and chairs

loans.name: Abdul Rahman

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Abdul Rahman. He is married and has two children, aged 1 and 4 years. In 2006, Abdul Rahman established his used clothing business. He began his business by selling for a friend. He acquired enough experience and business skills from his friend's business, which lead him to establish his own business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 3,941,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Abdul Rahman has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bales of used clothing for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Abdul Rahman plans to own a store as he now has a stall, and also to expand to other areas in the township. Most of the suppliers are located in Freetown.  

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for bales of used clothing for his business.

loans.name: J Trinidad

texts.es: El señor J Trinidad es un hombre ya grande de edad que no le gusta depender de sus hijos ya que el siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar para recibir su propio dinero. Hace 11 años el inicio con su negocio de abarrotes donde ofrece variedad de artículos de la canasta básica como los es refrescos, arroz, frijoles, lácteos y más. El negocio se encuentra ubicado en una calle principal de la ciudad y que es muy transitada el cual es un beneficio ya que de esta manera el recibe mayores ingresos. Para J Trinidad es muy importante tener su negocio bien surtido ya que es la única forma que recibe ingresos para el sostén familiar.
texts.en: J Trinidad is a senior citizen who no longer likes having to depend on his children.  He is a man who has always worked in order to earn his own money.  Eleven years ago he started a grocery business where he offers a variety of basic household items, such as rice, beans, milk products, and others.  The business is located on a well-travelled main city street.  This is a benefit and it brings him a large income.  For J Trinidad, having a well-stocked business is important, since it’s his only source of income for supporting his family.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Isata J

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Isata.  She is married, and has 3 children aged 5, 7 and 14. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her.  

In 2001, Isata established her business selling  clothes. She began her business after graduating from a technical school in Freetown. She sells mainly to young ladies and old men. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1, 200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of SLL 4,500,000. Isata requires the loan in order to  increase stock for the boutique. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 400,000. In the future, Isata plans to move the shop to the middle of the town and support her children’s education. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for dresses for her business.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La sra Cirila es una señora muy trabajadora, que se dedica a la produccion de leche cruda tiene cuatro cabezas de ganado lechero, que las cuida en su casa, ella casi vive en uan zona urbana y para evitarse problemas con los vecinos lleva a comer pasto a sus vacas a lugares alejados. 

La sra Cirila es una mujer emprendedora que le gusta su trabajo.Su esposo radica mayormente en la provincia Chapare, entonces ella se queda sola con su hija, quien esta estudiando en el colegio aun. La Sra. Cirila desea que con la compra de una vaca mas pueda ayudarle a generar mas ingresos y darle a su ultima hija mejores oportunidades y que pueda estudiar luego una carrera. Es asi que Cirila solicita el credito para comprar una cabeza de ganado lechero.
texts.en:
Cirila is a hardworking woman.  She has four dairy cows that she raises in her home and she specializes in raw milk.  She lives in an urban zone and takes her cows to graze in distant pastures to avoid problems with her neighbors.

Cirila is an enterprising woman who likes to work.  Her husband mostly stays in the Chapare province, so she stays with her daughter who attends the local school.  Cirila would like to buy another cow in order to increase her income and provide better opportunities to her daughter, so that she can study and have a career.  Cirila is asking for this loan to buy another dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a mik cow.

loans.name: Idrissa Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Idrissa.  He is single, and has 1 child aged 5 years. He has 6 additional dependents, who live with him to assist his younger brothers and sisters with their education.  

In 1999, Idrissa established his building materials business. He began his business by selling cosmetics and now has transformed to selling building materials. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Idrissa has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy building materials. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Idrissa plans to expand his business to other areas in the town as a strategy to earn more profits. He serves contractors, builders and the general public. The need for housing is very great in the township and therefore he has a lot of customers. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for building materials.

loans.name: Guadalupe Isabel

texts.es: Guadalupe Isabel es una joven emprendedora, que no porque sea mujer está limitada a realizar trabajos que los hombres solo pueden hacer, hace poco inicio su negocio de lavado de automóviles donde ella también realiza esta actividad junto con su esposo donde lavan variedad de muebles como es camionetas, camiones, carros pequeños, taxi y mas a un precio accesible. El servicio que ofrece es lavar por fuera y aspirar por dentro dejando un aroma agradable para que le guste al cliente. En este momento necesita comprar una maquina de compresor de agua para poder lavar mejor el automóvil y ahorrar agua de esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos y ayudara al planeta.
texts.en: Guadalupe Isabel is a young enterprising woman who is not limited to doing “women’s work.”  A short time ago she started a car washing business where she and her husband wash various types of vehicles, such as  vans, trucks, small cars, and taxis at affordable prices.  The service includes an exterior wash, vacuuming, and applying air freshener so that the customer will like it.  At this time she needs to buy a pressure washer to be able to better wash the cars and save water.  In this way she can increase her income and help protect the planet.

loans.use: to buy a pressure washer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora María es una madre soltera de un pequeña de 2 años, de la cual quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Maria trabaja para una maquiladora como operadora desde hace 11 años y medio, pero no le es suficiente lo que ella gana ya que el salario es muy mínimo y le rebajan su casa; por lo que ella opto fue en vender ropa nueva a sus compañera en pagos accesibles que trae de diferentes partes del país. En este momento requiere de un préstamo para comprar pantalones, chamarras, blusas, camisas vaqueras para la temporada decembrina  que es cuando le solicitan más, para estrenar o regalar en Navidad. Es el tiempo que aprovecha María por es cuando recibe más ganancias y de esta manera podrá subir la economía de su hogar.
texts.en: Mrs. María is the single mother of a two-year-old daughter to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. Maria has worked in a maquiladora as a machine operator for eleven and a half years. However, her salary is not enough; it is very minimal, and deductions are taken for the housing program. For this reason, she decided to sell new clothing to her friends. She brings in clothing from all around the country and sells it for easy payments. She now needs a loan to purchase pants, jackets, blouses, and denim shirts for the December season; this is when she has the most orders, as customers are getting ready for parties or wanting to give Christmas gifts. Maria takes advantage of this season; it is the time in which she makes the most money and is able to increase her household's income.

loans.use: to buy clothing, such as pants, blouses, and shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for jeans, shirts, boots, sneakers and t-shirts for his business.

loans.name: Alie

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Alie. He is married, and has 3 children aged 5, 11 and 16 years. 

In 2008, Alie established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wants to be self reliant and to take good care of his home. He also started the business in a stall and now owns a store. Most people prefer used clothing to new products and he has a lot customers. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Alie has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bales of used clothes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. 

In the future, Alie plans to own another shop in a town nearby where a market day is organized. He also wants the profits to increase so as to care for his family. He serves customers of all ages and mostly males. Most of his suppliers are located in Freetown. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for used clothes.

loans.name: Elena Filadelfia De La Cuz

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi (Portoviejo), cantón conocido  por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Elena. Tiene  61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 6 hijos pero dos fallecieron, los 4 restantes  ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se  dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, ella compra tanto a los pollos como a los chanchos cuando aun están pequeños,  luego los tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado para después venderlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa. Lleva en esta actividad desde que se comprometió con su esposo hace más de 40 años y le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a sus hijos cuando lo necesitaron.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimentos y medicinas para pollos y chanchos. Ella está desde el inicio en el  Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les dan con los créditos.
  
Nuestra amiga está repitiendo el crédito y ha solicitado este crédito para comprar más alimentos para que sus animalitos estén bien grandes o gordos para las fiestas que se avecinan ya que en estos días se venden muchos de sus animalitos y a muy buen precio. Ella con lo que gano en este ciclo construyo un nuevo corral para meter más animalitos y en su casa también hizo varios arreglos en su cocina con lo cual mejoro un poco su vida por eso espera seguir adelante con los créditos para seguir mejorando su vida.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the La Sequita de Montecristi parish. The canton is known for their famous Panama hats, which are valued inside and outside of the country.

Elena lives in this area. She is 61 years old and married. She has had six children but two of them have died. The other four are older in age and independent. Her husband works in farming. 

In order to help her husband with the household expenses, Elena raises pigs and chickens.  She purchases as many chickens as she does pigs when they are still young. She keeps them for three or four months until they are at an adequate weight to sell to vendors who come to her house. She has done this work since she started her relationship with her husband more than 40 years ago. The business has helped her children make progress when necessary. 

This loan will be used to purchase food and medicine for the chickens and pigs. She has been a part of the communal bank since its start. She likes it because of the help provided by the loans. 

Our friend, Elena, is repeating her loan and she had requested it in order to purchase more food to make the animals larger and to give them a good price. The money received in this cycle was used to construct a new farmyard for more animals. She also made various repairs in her kitchen to improve her quality of life a little. She hopes to continue to make progress with the loans in order to continue improving her life.
 
Her dreams are to move forward and to have good health for her and her family.

loans.use: purchase food and medicine for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Herlinda Mariuxi

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi (Portoviejo), cantón conocido  por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Herlinda, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo  de seis meses de nacido. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende pollos por libras y en pie,  también se dedica a la cría de pollos pero como no tiene muchos pollos les compra a los vecinos de la zona y con esto les ayuda y se ayuda ya que les compra a muy buen precio con lo cual le queda buena ganancia, trabaja todos los días y a toda hora ya que su negocio lo tiene en su casa, lleva cinco años en su negocio y  le va bastante bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pollos para la cría y alimento para los mismos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cuatro ciclos  y le gusta porque se lleva muy bien con todas sus compañeras.
 
Ella está repitiendo el crédito y ha solicitado este crédito para comprar más pollos y tener bastante  para las fiestas que se avecinan ya que en estos días se venden muchos de sus animalitos y a muy buen precio, desde que recibe estos créditos todo se le ha facilitado ya que no tiene que preocuparse por pedir dinero a otras personas que se  llevaban la mayoría de sus ganancias, lo que es  ahora le queda más para arreglar su casa y darle lo mejor a su hijo.

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the La Sequita de Montecristi parish. The canton is known for their famous Panama hats, which are valued inside and outside of the country.

Herlinda lives in this area. She is 22 years old and married. She has one seven month old son. Her husband works in a factory in Manta. 

She has a small part of her home where she sells chicken by the pound and by the feet. She also raises chickens. However, since she does not have many chickens, her neighbors buy them. That way, she helps them and she helps herself since they buy them at a good price.  She’s able to earn a good profit. She works every day and all day because her business is in her house. She has had this business for 5 years and it is going well. 

This loan is to purchase chickens for raising and food for those chickens. She has been a part of the communal bank for four cycles.  She likes it because she gets along well with the other members.

She requested the loan to purchase more chicken in order to have lots for the upcoming holidays and parties. Nowadays, she is selling lots of her animals at very good prices. Since she started receiving these loans, she does not have to worry about asking other people for money and then taking the majority of her earnings. Now she has more money to repair her house and give the best to her son.

 Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: purchase chickens and food for those chickens.

loans.name: Baindu

texts.en:
This is Baindu.  She is divorced, and has 5 children aged 4, 7, 16, 21 and 26 years. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her to assist in the business.  

In 2001, Baindu established her cookery and palm oil business. Her business started on a small scale in the outskirts of town but she now services a lot of customers. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Baindu has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more cooking condiments she uses in her cookery. She will use this loan to buy 2 bags of rice at Le 270,000, 15 gallons palm oil at Le 270,00 and 1 cartoon tomato paste at Le 40,000. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Baindu plans to improve on the business to a level of creating her own canteen, hiring staff to work for her and to educate her children to the university level. Her suppliers are all within town. She also plans to save for her house project and improve on her children's welfare. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for bags of rice, gallons of palm oil and tomato paste for her business.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi (Portoviejo), cantón conocido  por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos de 18, 16, 14, 11, 7 y 5 años de edad, todos estudian en colegio y escuela y el menor en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella es una muy buena  ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos se dedica al comercio, vende productos de plástico como platos, vasos, fundas, entre otros productos hechos en plástico, trabaja todos los días mas que todo en las mañanas ya que a esta hora es más fresco y puede realizar mejor sus recorridos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Lleva más de dos años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar platos, sillas, vasos, baldes, entre otras cosas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos  y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado tanto la institución como sus compañeras. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the La Sequita de Montecristi parish. The canton is known for their famous Panama hats, which are valued inside and outside of the country.

María lives in this area. She is 34 years old and married. She has six children from this relationship. They are 18, 16, 14, 11, 7 and 5 years old. The older ones all study in secondary or primary school. The youngest one is in nursery school. Her husband is a construction worker. 

María is a very good housewife. She earns her own income through her business selling plastic products like plates, vases, covers and other things made out of plastic.  She works every day. She does more work in the mornings because it is cooler at this time and she can cover her routes better.  She delivers her products on credit and collects money every weekend. She has had this business for more than two years and it is going very well. 

This loan will be used to purchase plates, seats, vases, buckets and other things. She has been a member of this communal bank for three cycles. She likes it because of the help given to her and the other members from the institution. 

Her dreams are to continue moving forward and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: purchase plates, seats, vases, buckets, etc.

loans.name: Francis G

texts.en:
This is 45 year-old Francis. He is married, and has 3 children aged 2, 3 and 4 years old. He has 1 additional dependent, who lives with him to assist his wife in the house chores.

In 1996, Francis established his beverages, soft drinks, stout, beer and gins business. He began his business because he wants to be independent; the business started by selling on market days for his uncle and now he has his own business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Francis has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy 10 crates soft drinks at Le 310,000, 10 crates stout at Le 900,000, 10 crates beer at Le 500,000 and 20 cartoons of gin at Le 860,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. 

In the future, Francis plans to become a distributor to one of the brewery companies. The business will grow to a level of having to employ other people. The family would be comfortable. His products are consumed by people especially as an after work activity to reduce stress. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for beverages, stout, beer, and gin for his business.

loans.name: Maritza Moncerrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi (Portoviejo), cantón conocido  por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 14, 11, 6 y 2 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y  el menor en escuela. Su esposo es ayudante de albañil.

Ella es una muy buena  ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos se dedica al comercio, vende productos de plástico como platos, vasos, escobas, recogedores, sillas, entre otras cosas, trabaja de tres a cuatro días de la semana, sale a hacer sus recorridos con la ayuda de sus hijos, deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Sus productos los compra en un local en Picoaza ya que le dan a muy buen precio. Lleva cuatro años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar platos, sillas, vasos, baldes, escobas,  entre otras cosas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace seis  ciclos  y le gusta porque el grupo es bien unido.
 
Su sueño es tener un local.
texts.en:
The "María Inmaculada" communal bank meets every two weeks in the parish of Montecristi (Portoviejo), a place known for the famous toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats), that are prized inside and outside the country. 

This is where Maritza lives. She is 32, married, and has four children, ages 14, 11, 6, and 2. The older children go to school, and the youngest is in pre-school.  Her husband is a bricklayer's helper. She is a very good homemaker, who has a small business to earn her own income. She sells plastic products such as plates, glasses, brooms, dustpans, chairs, and other items. 

She works three to four days a week, and goes out to do her rounds with her children's help. She extends credit, and collects every weekend. She buys her products at a shop in Picoazo, as they sell them to her at a good price. She has been in this business for four years, and it's going very well. 

This loan is to buy plates, chairs, glasses, buckets, brooms, and other items. She has been in the communal bank for six cycles, and likes it because the group is really close. Her dream is to have a shop.

loans.use: To buy plates, chairs, glasses, buckets, brooms,etc.

loans.name: Mónica Kaituska

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi (Portoviejo), cantón conocido  por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Mónica, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y está esperando a su primer hijo. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de la localidad.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja  de tres  a cuatro días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Ella empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución y lo ha ido mejorando con los créditos que ha recibido. Lo que más vende son los perfumes ya que son muy buenos.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa en general. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le ayudan mucho.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener a su bebé.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada credit group meets every fifteen days in the parish church of La Sequita de Montecristi (Portoviejo).  The region is known for its famous straw hats, which are highly valued both inside and outside the country.

This is the place where Mónica lives.  She is 23 years old, married, and is expecting her first child.  Her husband works at a factory in town.

Mónica is a housewife who makes a living selling clothing from a catalog along with Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women).  She works three to four days a week; she leaves her products on credit and then collects payment for them on the weekend.  She started her business with the first loan she received from the lending institution, and she has improved her business with the subsequent loans she has received.  Her best-selling items are the perfumes, since they are very good.

Mónica will use this loan to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing.  She has been with the communal bank from the beginning, and she likes it because the loans are fast and very helpful.  

Her dream is to get ahead and to have her baby.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi (Portoviejo), cantón conocido  por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de tres y de un año y medio. Su esposo es albañil. Ella lleva cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.

Es una joven ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en la dura tarea de mantener el hogar  se  dedica a la cría y venta de chanchos y pollos, ella compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños y luego los tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado para después venderlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa, para luego llevarlos a los mercados de otras ciudades. Su esposo le ayuda cuando puede en la alimentación y cuidado de los animales. Lleva dos años con esta actividad y le gusta porque se gana algo sin salir de su casa.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimento y medicinas tanto para pollos y chanchos y poder aprovechar la época que se avecina donde hay bastante venta de estos animalitos.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada communal bank meets every 15 days in the parish of La Sequita de Montecristi, Portoviejo. The area is known for the famous "panama"-style hats made of toquilla straw, which are well known in the country and abroad.

This is where Señora Rosa lives. She is 20 years old, and is married with two children, one aged 3 and one ages 18 months. Her husband is a bricklayer. She has been with the communal bank for five loan cycles, and she likes it because of the very low interest rates available. 
She is a young housewife, who helps her husband to provide for the family by raising and selling pigs and chickens. She buys the animals while they are still small and keeps them for three or four months, until they are a sufficient size to sell. She sells them to dealers who come to the house and take the animals to be sold at markets in other cities. Her husband helps her when he can, with feeding and caring for the animals. She has been working in this way for two years, and she likes it because it means she can earn some money without leaving the house.

Rosa plans to use the loan to buy food and medicines for her chickens and pigs, to be able to make the most of the coming season when sales are likely to be good.

Her dream is to give her children the best she can.

loans.use: To buy food and medicines for her pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en:
Chhoem is a rice cultivator from Kampong Chhnang province. She has been living there with her parents since she was young. She is now 48 years old and a good mother of 6 single children. The profit she earns from farming business is just for daily food, but it doesn’t provide a better living condition for this family. 

Chhoem is a hardworking mother and is always busy with her farming work alongside her husband to support her family. Chhoem would like to take out some funds from HKL and Kiva to pay for her children’s school fees and enrollments in the new academic year. She is very happy that she can send and support all her children to attend school.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s school fees and enrollments in the new academic year.

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie is married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emie is 42-years-old and has 1 child who is in school.

Emie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Emie requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Emie has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Emie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

Imelda has been in this business for 15 years.

Imelda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a hat making business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her hat making business.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials for her hat making business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is married with 5 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elsa is 41-years-old and has 2 children who are in school.

Elsa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Elsa requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Elsa has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Savem

texts.en:
Savem, 36, is married and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Savem is a farmer and her husband is a construction worker.

Savem is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a rice threshing machine to improve her family's farming. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a rice threshing machine to improve her family's farming

loans.name: Jelmarie

texts.en:
Jelmarie is 52 years old and married with 4 children.

Jelmarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Jelmarie has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jelmarie aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Yart

texts.en:
Yart, 59, is married and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Yart is a housewife and her husband is a construction worker. 

Yart is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. By doing so, her family will be able to decrease the expenses for public transportation. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy, 47, is married and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Chanthy is employed at a garment factory.

Chanthy is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a plot of farmland to produce more rice to sell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to produce more rice

loans.name: Meoun

texts.en:
Meoun, 58, is married and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Meoun is a farmer.

Meoun is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. By doing so, her family will be able to decrease the expenses for public transportation. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam, 36, is married and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Nam is a housewife, and her husband is a construction worker. Nam is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. By doing so, her family is able to decrease their public transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun, 47, is married and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Oun and her husband are farmers. Oun is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase piglets to raise for sale. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en: Nyamdorj is 32 years old and lives with his wife and son in ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. His wife is pregnant, and the due date is next month. His 5-year-old son goes to kindergarden. He started his transportation business in 2009 with his own van. He transports people from province to province. His car has many problems, due to the horrible countryside roads. His car's engine is making a terrible noise, and the car doesn't get warm. Therefore, customers are not satisfied. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I have another baby coming; therefore, I need to do everything I can to run my business properly." He is requesting 2,500,000 tugriks to repair his car's engine and put heat in the van.

loans.use: to repair his car's engine and add heat

loans.name: Radnaabazar

texts.en: Radnaabazar is 61 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai Province, Mongolia. Her husband is a retired old man, and her kids are all independent. She started her business in 1998 by renting a counter in a market. Her product range is broad, and she is well respected in the market. Now that her kids are grown, she wants to concentrate on her business. She already rented an additional counter in a market. However, her supplies are not sufficient to run a whole business. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My business served me well. My kids are educated and my family is healthy. However, my income has been the same since I started, so I want to expand it." She is requesting 1,200,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase more curds.

loans.use: To purchase more curds

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mrs. Phon, 29, the mother of two school-age kids, is involved in an agricultural business. Phon and her husband work together on the existing farmland. Agriculture is the sole source of their income, and they typically earn an average of $5.00 per day to satisfy their financial needs. Mrs. Phon wants to take some time to raise piglets behind her house, but she really needs some funds to invest in this project. Thus, she is looking for a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase some piglets and feed for her pig-fattening business. With the rest of the funds, she will also buy crop seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to grow her farming business well as she strives to work.

loans.use: to purchase some piglets and feed for her pig-fattening business

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en: Munhtsetseg is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in her own apartment in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband runs a car workshop, and her sons are college students. She started her cell-phone repair and parts shop in 2007 by renting a counter in a market. Her repair skills are excellent and seem to be attracting many customers. However, her equipment is old, so she is unable to repair new phones, like smart phones. Therefore, she is requesting 3,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy new equipment to run her business properly. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I love what I do. However, my equipment is old, and repairing smart phones is highly profitable. If I could buy the necessary equipment I could pay my boys' college fees."

loans.use: to buy new equipment

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 38 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom attend school. As a responsible mother, she works hard all day long to provide income for her family. 

Esmeralda has a small store selling farm supplies, such as pesticides, insecticides, and other chemicals used in faming, which she has had for two years. She also sells livestock feeds. She works from 6 AM to 7 PM. She had  been in this business for almost two years. 

Esmeralda is requesting a loan for 40,000 PHP, which she will use to buy livestock feeds, insecticides, and pesticides to sell in her store. Esmeralda hopes that the loan will improve her business and increase her sales capacity. She hopes to keep generating a good income to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of livestock feed and 10 liters of insecticides and pesticides to sell in her store.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Otgonbayar is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Govisumber Province, Mongolia. Her husband has a stable job. Their three children go to school and kindergarden. She started her business in 2010 selling cart food. Now she rents a counter in a market selling groceries. Now that her business is stable enough, she wants to expand her business by selling fruit. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy fruit.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Tserenbyamba

texts.en: Tserenbyamba is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business. Her eldest kid is a school student, and her youngest one goes to kindergarden. She started her car-part retailing business in 2006 by renting a container in a local market. Her business has gone well, so she decided to expand her business by renting another container in the market. She already rented another container. However, her supplies are not sufficient to run a whole container. Therefore, she is requesting 3,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase oil and spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase oil and spare parts

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mr. Hong is a 32-year-old married man and the loving father of two school-aged kids. To earn a living, he cultivates rice crops, both in the rainy season and the dry season. He’s very hardworking and a responsible husband who always spends most of his time at the fields. From this business, he is able to generate an income of approximately $1.50 each day. His wife also helps him in earning income by working in a garment factory as a sewing worker in Kampong Chhnang Province. With this loan amount, Mr. Hong intends to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for growing his dry-season rice. His future goal is to build a construction team and own construction projects.
